description:
Full Job Description
Job Description

At Freddie Mac, you will do important work to build a better housing finance system and you’ll be part of a team helping to make homeownership and rental housing more accessible and affordable across the nation.

Position Overview:
Are you looking for an inclusive company culture to ease the transition from college into the workforce? The Single-Family division within Freddie Mac is searching for creative individuals to join our organization!

Freddie Mac is a dynamic environment with constant change, enabling interns to grow with us through a wide variety of experiences and responsibilities. Interns at Freddie Mac have the opportunity to actively work on real-world projects while developing skills that will apply directly to their careers and provide them broad exposure to Freddie Mac's outstanding role in the mortgage industry!

Our Impact:
Our team is responsible for supporting the activities related to the mortgage loan delivery and securitization process
We assist in the integration of our innovative Loan Advisor product – electronic capabilities crafted to help our mortgage lenders deliver a superior borrower experience
We collaborate with clients and IT management to assist and support the design, development and implementation of effective systems

Your Impact:
In this role, you will be supporting the business to build tools that will fundamentally change the mortgage origination, delivery, and securitizations process
You will be encouraged to work collaboratively with internal and external partners representing various groups across the organization
You will build relationships and learn to connect with customers respectfully in a “partnership” style
By collaborating with your team, you will review, understand and act on customer feedback
You will partner with others within your team and assist them in finding patterns and relationships in data

Qualifications:
Minimum cumulative 3.0 GPA
Graduating in December 2022 or May 2023
Bachelor’s degree in Business Administration, Finance, Economics, Real Estate, Business Information Technology, Computer Science, Management Information Systems, Mathematics, Data Science/Analytics, Communications, Marketing, or a related subject area
Availability to begin an internship with our 2022 class beginning in May

Keys to Success in this Role:
Exceptional communication skills, both written and verbal
Strong Microsoft Office skills
Excellent interpersonal and facilitation skills
Must be a great teammate and able to work collaboratively

Current Freddie Mac employees please apply through the internal career site.

Today, Freddie Mac makes home possible for one in four home borrowers and is one of the largest sources of financing for multifamily housing. Join our smart, creative and dedicated team and you’ll do important work for the housing finance system and make a difference in the lives of others.

We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity and inclusion at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, disability status or any other characteristic protected by applicable law. We will ensure that individuals with differing abilities are provided reasonable accommodation to participate in the job application or interview process, to perform essential job functions, and to receive other benefits and privileges of employment. Please contact us to request accommodation.

Notice to External Search Firms: Freddie Mac partners with BountyJobs for contingency search business through outside firms. Resumes received outside the BountyJobs system will be considered unsolicited and Freddie Mac will not be obligated to pay a placement fee. If interested in learning more, please visit www.BountyJobs.com and register with our referral code: MAC.

Time-type:Full time

Job Category:Intern / Temporary

FLSA Status:Non-Exempt

Full Job Description

The Research and Development department at DigiStream Investigations Inc. is looking for a curious, organized and motivated individual to join the team on a part-time basis as the R&D Intern.

DigiStream Investigations
Venture Management Specialists, Inc

Position: Research & Development Intern (paid internship)

Starting Hourly Rate: $16.00 per hour

Work Status: Part-time hours, and flexible weekly work schedule to accommodate your weekly school schedule

Office Location: West Sacramento, CA

*Great opportunity to gain work experience, and for career advancement!

Job Summary:

DigiStream Investigations is a national investigative firm with twenty affiliate offices and growing. By joining this exciting and fast-paced team, the R&D Intern will get a chance to participate in cutting-edge research projects, provide critical assistance in investigations, and learn about how technology impacts and enhances the investigative tradecraft. This individual should be currently working towards their Bachelor’s degree.

Responsibilities:

With guidance from all R&D Specialists, the R&D Intern will be expected to:

· Assist with research projects and experiments in the field

· Help extract key insights from data entry, analysis, and visualization

· Learn and utilize current R&D programs and software used for investigations

· Provide essential support and insight to R&D Specialists regarding investigations, projects, and special affiliate requests

· Assess experimental software and hardware for effectiveness and report all results to the team

· Track all completed advanced assignments in established R&D logs

· Preserve and deliver confidential evidence as requested

· Fulfill requests from department employees and affiliate offices

· Create and manage auxiliary open-source intelligence resources, such as investigative social media accounts

· Attend operations meetings to discuss ideas and project findings with the team

· Other duties as needed

Requirements:

· Strong research and writing skills

· Strong organizational and communication skills

· Working towards a degree in an applicable field such as Criminal Justice, Computer Science, Psychology, History, Political Science or Journalism

· Ability to work independently and meet deadlines

· Willingness to learn basic investigative methodology and practices

· Willingness to learn and use new software and hardware

· Ability to interpret, analyze, and distill information from databases, social media, and government/private entities

· Maintain confidentiality of subject and client information, as well as DigiStream’s investigative methods and technology

· No prior hardware/software experience is required, however a demonstrated history of successful troubleshooting is preferred

**Please provide a Resume and Cover Letter when applying for this position!

Full Job Description

Information Security Intern:

Under the direction of a seasoned professional, participates in network penetration testing and vulnerability assessment, as well as information technology audits. Most work will be remote, with occasional on-site testing.

Skills and experience:

· We are looking for a social science, computer science, or business major, preferably a senior who is looking to get their start, or a junior who has plenty of coursework behind them and can work with us through their senior year.

· Coding and/or other technology skills are a plus, as are knowledge of back-office operations.

· Clear, concise writer.

· Professional presentation – in writing, by phone, sometimes in person.

Compensation and terms:

· $25/hour

· We will guarantee a minimum 25 hours per month. But if exams or other matters conflict, we can agree to less than 25 hours in any given month, upon request. If the candidate wishes to work more than 25 hours, that may be arranged on a month-by-month basis.

· We make 401-k contributions and have a health plan available.

Full-time, as scheduled; five-month duration with a possibility to extend beyond the five months.

Full Job Description
Job Description

At Freddie Mac, you will do important work to build a better housing finance system and you’ll be part of a team helping to make homeownership and rental housing more accessible and affordable across the nation.

Position Overview:
Are you looking for an inclusive company culture to ease the transition from college into the workforce? The Internal Audit division within Freddie Mac is searching for collaborative and creative individuals to join our organization!

We have a dynamic environment with constant change, enabling interns to grow with us through a wide variety of experiences and responsibilities. Interns at Freddie Mac have the opportunity to actively work on real-world projects while developing skills that will apply directly to their careers and provide them broad exposure to Freddie Mac's outstanding role in the mortgage industry!

Our Impact:
Freddie Mac’s Internal Audit division plays a meaningful role in the company’s approach to managing risk by providing independent, objective, and value-added assurance of risk management, governance, and controls.

Your Impact:
You will support Internal Audit by working on high-impact audit projects that evaluate Freddie Mac’s business, including the opportunity to develop and present your recommendations for improvement to management.
You will work collaboratively with your colleagues to execute projects, sharing knowledge and building relationships with an audit team comprised of diverse talents, backgrounds, experience, and skillsets.
You will learn about key areas of Freddie Mac’s business, including related risks and internal controls, from external partners across the organization.

Qualifications:
Minimum cumulative 3.2 GPA
Bachelor’s degree in Accounting, Finance, Audit, Management Information Systems, Data Analytics, or Business Administration with an emphasis on Technology, Computer Science, Accounting Information Systems or a related field
Availability to begin internship in May 2022, with expected graduation Fall 2022 or Spring 2023 graduation

Keys to Success in this Role:
Must work creatively and analytically in a problem-solving environment
Must be a phenomenal teammate and able to work collaboratively
Outstanding communication skills, both written and verbal

Current Freddie Mac employees please apply through the internal career site.

Today, Freddie Mac makes home possible for one in four home borrowers and is one of the largest sources of financing for multifamily housing. Join our smart, creative and dedicated team and you’ll do important work for the housing finance system and make a difference in the lives of others.

Full Job Description
Intern position with the Global Strike and Product Support (GSPS) software development team working for US Strategic Command creating Web-based and Java mission systems supporting the Intelligence, Global Strike, and Nuclear Planning communities. The qualified candidate will be mentored by experienced software engineers and learn Agile / DevSecOps methodologies, web development best practices, full-stack design patterns, and secure software techniques in the Rogue Blue Software (RBS) Software Factory environment.

The qualified candidate will work within teams of 3-6 software engineers to create / improve software systems within the Integrated Strategic Planning and Analysis Network (ISPAN) Mission Planning and Application System (MPAS) system of systems which assists USSTRATCOM with the development of nuclear and conventional kinetic/non-kinetic strike options.

Responsibilities will include software development, unit testing, design, debugging, defect correction, support to team peer reviews, and interaction with systems engineers, architects, scrum masters, product owners, and end users to understand the mission and system requirements for software tasks.

Basic Qualifications:
  • Enrolled in an accredited college / university pursuing a Bachelor’s degree in Computer Engineering, Computer Science, or MIS
Minimum 3.0 GPA desired but not required
  • Ability to develop Web or Java code in a team environment
  • Candidate must have excellent oral and written communication skills.
Ability to obtain a security clearance

Desired Skills:
1) Experience with JavaScript (Ext JS, Vue JS), CSS, and HTML
2) Experience with Spring Framework patterns
3) Experience with Object/Relational Mapping Framework (Hibernate) or SQL
4) Experience with Web Services (REST) or JSON/XML experience.
5) Experience with Kubernetes/Cloud Environments
6) Familiarity with development tooling Eclipse, GIT, GITLab, Gradle, JUnit, JIRA

position: Intern to support Education and Make a Difference!
description:
Full Job Description

Nonprofit Internships and Volunteer Opportunities

Cause: Education

Manhattan OR Remote / Virtual / Work from Home

Many students, recent graduates, and professionals have lost (or been unable to find) internships or jobs due to COVID-19. We feel so bad for all those who have been impacted in that way.

While we cannot pay, our nonprofit does offer an outstanding opportunity to use your skills, gain experience, enhance your resume, and make a tremendous positive social impact on the causes or communities you care about, including Education.

Greatest Impact

This may be the single best opportunity for you to make the greatest possible positive impact in the world.

Who Is It For?

We have many roles to fill here, so we need high-achieving interns and volunteers with a range of experience. We therefore welcome:

· Professionals who want to volunteer part-time

· "Dependent Spouses" of H1-B, F1, and L1 visa holders

· Recent graduates, including international students on OPT

· Undergraduate and graduate school students, including international students on CPT, who want to intern or to join us as a school ambassador

· Outstanding high school students, who want to intern or to join us as a school ambassador

Credit for Students

Internships with ChangingThePresent are eligible for credit from many schools, and we are happy to do our part to meet the school's requirements.

When

We are always hiring: school year or summer; full-time or part-time.

About Us

ChangingThePresent.org is a 501(c)(3) nonprofit. The New York Times called us an “Amazon.com of the nonprofit world.”

We make the experience of a donation, which you can give in a friend’s name, feel like a rewarding present and an appealing alternative to buying and giving yet more unwanted "stuff." In this way, we are starting to channel to nonprofits some of the $450 billion Americans spend each year buying birthday, wedding, holiday, and corporate presents. Imagine how much good we could all do together as more of that money goes to making a difference.

· Our visitors can contribute to provide school children with their first book, preserve an acre of the wilderness, fund an hour of cancer research, etc.

· Wish lists and registries let them share their dreams for a better world.

· Personalized greeting cards make a charitable gift especially memorable. Gift cards let friends support the things they care about.

We already work with hundreds of the most prestigious nonprofits in the country, and we are now opening the site to all nonprofits so they can all attract additional funding for their important missions.

Unprecedented Opportunities for Responsibility and Leadership

Our interns and volunteers get more responsibility than they would anywhere else. You can take a leadership role.

Focus on Education Nonprofits

We seek high-achieving interns and volunteers who want to take a leadership role and make a difference for the cause of Education.

You can also choose to focus on your favorite causes (including education, hunger, women, children, cancer, human rights, environment, women, veterans, etc.) or the charitable needs of any ethnic group, religious group, city, or country. Please see the growing list of causes, countries, cities, ethnic groups, and religious groups on which we focus at https://changingthepresent.org/collections/gifts

For the Education and Every Cause, Interns and Volunteers Will do the Following:

· Identify, research, prioritize, and invite potential Advisors and Experts.

· Identify, research, prioritize, and invite nonprofits, who can register and list their charitable gifts at no cost. The opportunity for them is discussed in the slideshow on this page: https://changingthepresent.org/pages/for-nonprofits

· Identify, research, prioritize, and pitch magazines, websites, blogs, professional organizations, social media channels, online communities, and other ways to reach people who care about each specific cause.

· Identify, research, and pitch strategic partners for the cause.

· Identify, research, prioritize, and pitch sources of growth funding (philanthropists, corporations, or foundations)

· Conceive of and create cause marketing sponsorship proposals.

· Identify and invite the promotional support of celebrities who support the cause/community.

Focus on Ethnic, Religious, City, or Country Communities

We also have opportunities to focus on the charitable needs of any ethnic, religious, city, or country communities.

Opportunities for Most Areas of Academic / Professional Focus

We also have positions that align with a wide range of academic and professional fields, including business development, analytics, finance, accounting, technology, web development, Salesforce, database, computer science, science, STEM education, marketing, digital marketing, communications, social media, publishing, Human Resources, organizational psychology, research, education, and graphics.

Specific Markets

Some interns focus on specific markets, such as the high school market, college market, wedding market, or corporate gift market.

You Benefit

We want all our interns to get the following from their experience here:

· Make a tremendous positive impact in the world.

· Use your skills, experience, knowledge, creativity and talent.

· Assume responsibility and take a leadership role.

· Learn a tremendous amount.

· Work with people from around the world in a diverse and supportive community, and have a great time.

· Enhance your resume with a record of professional achievement and community service.

· Receive a great letter of recommendation.

When

We welcome full-time and part-time interns during the school year and/or the summer. We are entrepreneurial and flexible, and we are always hiring.

Where

Our office is conveniently located at 7th Avenue and 33 Streets in Manhattan. We also have interns who work remotely (as are all of us during the pandemic).

Please Share

We hope you will also share this opportunity with anyone who might be interested.

* *Learn More and Apply Now

Read more about our internships at:

https://ChangingThePresent.org/pages/interns-and-volunteers.

Then, please send a resume and short cover letter about your specific interests and your available dates/days/hours to: join [AT] ChangingThePresent [DOT] org.

Thank you very much!

Full Job Description
We are a Veteran-owned company that supports a collection of companies working directly with Veterans to help them maximize their VA disability compensation. We assist by helping these Veterans with the critical documentation and medical records-gathering process.

Are you in the business of changing people’s lives? At Loxley, we passionately provide high quality Management IT, and Marketing services to our various organizations that help Veterans learn about and achieve the disability benefits they have rightfully earned.

Benefits for Information Technology Intern:
Hands on experience with guidance from mentors.
Paid internship with the opportunity to become a permanent employee.
Potentially joining a rapidly growing organization.
Planned activities and team building recreation.

Essential Duties & Responsibilities for Information Technology Intern:

Assisting with managing a backlog of small development tasks using proprietary software.
Performing Quality Assurance testing on fellow team members developments.
Composing status updates on assigned work.
Learning the Agile methodology popularly used by Software Development Team.

Required Skills & Competencies for Information Technology Intern:

College student pursuing a degree in computer science, software engineering, software development, or another related field.
Available full-time hourly for an 8-week period or part-time hourly at a rate of 20 hours per week.
Strong written and verbal communication skills.
Strong attention to detail.
Strong general computing skills.
Hunger to learn new technologies and translate them into working software.
Ability to identify opportunities to adopt innovative technologies.
While performing the duties of this position, the employee is regularly required to talk or hear.
The intern frequently is required to use hands or fingers, handle or feel objects, tools, or controls.
Use of the computer and keyboard are frequent.
The intern is regularly required to stand; walk; sit; and reach with hands and arms.
The intern must occasionally lift and/or move up to 25 pounds.
Specific vision abilities required by this position include close vision, distance vision, and the ability to adjust focus.
The noise level in the work environment is usually low to moderate.

#INDLOX

This position is remote. We are mandating remote employees have a minimum internet speed of 10 Download/5 Upload to be eligible for hire.

Equal Opportunity Employer/Veterans/Disability

Full Job Description

Company Overview

Native is a platform using A.I. to understand consumer preferences and helping Consumer Packaged Goods (CPG) companies create products that people love. It is the only platform in the market that uses end-to-end data and artificial intelligence to optimize CPG products and supply chains. Our platform consists of three natively unified applications that accelerate R&D at all levels.

Native was founded in 2018 in New York City with additional offices in St. Louis, Cincinnati and Miami.

*
Role Overview
*
*

  • Work alongside Native’s CTO, product, engineering & data science teams in a fast-paced environment to create an innovative software product
  • Attend sprint planning and demo calls with engineering and product teams to ensure UX/UI is considered in all aspects of our product roadmapping and feature enhancements
  • Evaluate the UX/UI of industry competitor platforms
  • Monitor product feedback & analytics from customers to determine which modules & features are most successful and identify those that need most improvement
  • Generate mock-ups & wireframes for new Native software products
  • Using Native’s branding kit to design company materials including: investment decks, sales decks, case studies etc.

*
*
Preferred Requirements
*
*

  • Pursuing college degree in one of the following focus area: Business, Computer Science, Computer-Human Interaction and/or working towards UX/UI certifications
  • Available 15-20 hours per week
  • Prior UX/UI internship experience

*

Full Job Description
Production Engineers (PEs) at Facebook are a hybrid between software and systems engineers and are core to every significant engineering effort that keeps Facebook running smoothly and scaling efficiently. PEs work within Facebook's product and infrastructure teams to make sure our products and services are reliable and scalable. This means writing code and debugging hard problems in live production that impacts over 2 billion people around the world. Our PEs are embedded in teams that work on products like Instagram, WhatsApp, Oculus and Videos to backend services like Storage, Cache and Network. Our team is comprised of varying levels of experience and backgrounds, from university grads to industry veterans. Relevant industry experience is important, but ultimately less so than your demonstrated abilities and attitude. Partnered alongside the best engineers in the industry on the coolest stuff around, the code and systems you work on will be in production and used by millions of users all around the world. We sail into uncharted waters every day at Facebook in Production Engineering.
Own back-end services like our Hadoop data warehouses, front-end services like Chat and Newsfeed, infrastructure components like our Memcached infrastructure, and everything in between
Write and review code, develop documentation, and debug the hardest problems, live, on some of the largest and most complex systems in the world
Experience in *nix (Linux, BSDs, or another UNIX-like OS)
Experience coding in at least one language
1 or more years with new development languages (Python, PHP, C++, and Java)
Must obtain work authorization in country of employment at the time of hire, and maintain ongoing work authorization during employment
Understanding of TCP/IP networking fundamentals
Knowledge of internet service architectures (such as load balancing, LAMP, CDN's
Currently has, or is in the process of obtaining, a BS/MS degree in CS, Engineering, or a related technical discipline
Intent to return to full-time degree program after completion of the internship
Facebook's mission is to give people the power to build community and bring the world closer together. Through our family of apps and services, we're building a different kind of company that connects billions of people around the world, gives them ways to share what matters most to them, and helps bring people closer together. Whether we're creating new products or helping a small business expand its reach, people at Facebook are builders at heart. Our global teams are constantly iterating, solving problems, and working together to empower people around the world to build community and connect in meaningful ways. Together, we can help people build stronger communities - we're just getting started.
Facebook is proud to be an Equal Opportunity and Affirmative Action employer. We do not discriminate based upon race, religion, color, national origin, sex (including pregnancy, childbirth, or related medical conditions), sexual orientation, gender, gender identity, gender expression, transgender status, sexual stereotypes, age, status as a protected veteran, status as an individual with a disability, or other applicable legally protected characteristics. We also consider qualified applicants with criminal histories, consistent with applicable federal, state and local law. Facebook is committed to providing reasonable accommodations for candidates with disabilities in our recruiting process. If you need any assistance or accommodations due to a disability, please let us know at accommodations-ext@fb.com.

Full Job Description
Are you passionate about Facebook’s product, analytics and technology? The Analytics team is looking for fast-moving analytics candidates and data junkies who want to make an impact. Candidates will help own analytics for a particular product or business at Facebook and work with product managers and engineers to translate the analysis into meaningful impact to the business. Please note that candidates will have a general interview and then we will make a determination of actual team assignments.
Perform large-scale data analysis to extract useful business insights

Curious, self-driven, analytical and excited to play with data

Facebook's mission is to give people the power to build community and bring the world closer together. Full Job Description
About the Internship:
Evtek is a full-service Recycling Technology Company that helps people, businesses, and municipalities who want money and data for their recyclables. The Evtek System is a reliable and trustworthy recycling solution that generates metrics to connect consumers to their actions and provides our customers value through rewards, discounts, consumer data, and higher quality raw materials. Unlike other companies that have aging and inefficient recycling processes, Evtek increases value by maximizing efficiency at every step of the supply chain.

Our team is small, fast, and agile and we are tackling some of the industry's most challenging problems every day. We are partnered with one of Long Island's largest recycling centers so we are able to test our technology in the real world and make a true difference in our community and beyond.

Remote work and In-Person Options Available:
Flexible Duration (10 Week Minimum).
Flexible Hours (Maximum 40 hours/week).

General Skills Required:
Passion for Recycling.
Rising Junior or Senior at Accredited 4 Year College currently pursuing a B.S. or M.S./Ph.D, with an expected graduation date of December 2021 or any time in 2022 or you have graduated within the last 12 months.
If not working remotely, able to travel to Brooklyn/Long Island
Curiosity, Creativity, and Patience.
Ability to grasp new concepts quickly.

Internship Track 1 - Software Engineering (Machine Learning-Focused).

Required Experience, Skills, and Education:
You are currently pursuing a B.S. or M.S./Ph.D in Machine Learning, Computer Science, Software Engineering, or related technical field, with an expected graduation date of 2021 or 2022 or you have graduated within the last 12 months.
You have experience working with any of these languages: Python, Go, Java, C++.
You are familiar with machine learning libraries or frameworks such as sklearn, keras, tensorflow, pytorch, spark-ml, R.
You have experience in ML engineering, through previous internships, coursework, or open-source projects.
You are passionate about designing software systems and shipping high-quality code.

Great Additional Experience:
You are familiar with DevOps cloud tools (AWS/EC2, or Google Cloud) or MLOps tools (Kubeflow).

Internship Track 2 - Mechanical Engineering (Robotics/Mechanism Design Focused).
Interns will apply design, analysis, and testing skills across mechanical, electrical, and software engineering disciplines to develop new robotic systems for recycling – working closely with a team of engineers through the development process from concept generation through end-to-end testing. This position requires the desire to solve complex problems in a fast-paced environment as well as provide feedback to others executing tasks across all active projects.

Responsibilities:
Mechanism design including bearings, gears, motors, springs, and other motion and static components.
Robotic system design including rapid component integration, detailed top-down development, and simulation.
High-Reliability design and analysis for long-life space applications.
Proactively identifying risks to technical progress and their appropriate mitigations.
Generating design, development, test plan, and interface control documentation.
Contributing to process improvement initiatives.

Required Experience, Skills, and Education:
Excellent intra-team and client-facing collaboration and communication.
Confidence to take initiative in work, learn quickly, and pursue problems to completion.
Knowledge of motion component design for robotic mechanisms.
Knowledge of common sensor and actuator models, integration, and practical concerns.
Experience in Autodesk Inventor, Solidworks, or similar CAD software.
Experienced in Matlab/Simulink, C, C++, Python, and familiar with other programming languages.

Internship Track 3 - Electrical Engineering.

Details:
Familiarity with test equipment to assist in troubleshooting and debugging (For Example, Digital Multimeter, Oscilloscope, Logic Analyzer, etc.)
Familiarity with microcontroller programming.
Familiarity with motor control electronics.
Electrical design including component selection for electrical ground support equipment (power supplies, motor controllers, MCU’s, etc) and harnessing.
Design and implement control algorithms and provide feedback to system-level design.
Experience with electronics in industrial applications is a plus, but not required.
Experience with board layout is a plus, but not required.
Able to work independently with minimum supervision.
Ability to problem solve and apply critical thinking skills.

Come join us and Close the Loop.

About Evtek:
We believe it is our responsibility to build a sustainable world. It is possible to naturally shift human behavior so that together we save and maintain the world's beauty, instead of destroying it. When our customers recycle with us, we go to extraordinary lengths to ensure them that they aren't just recycling, they are truly contributing to closing the loop. Our incentive-based programs coupled with advanced metrics allow individuals and corporations to easily adopt a sustainable lifestyle. When you recycle with us it is just the beginning, through our educational programs and eco-friendly product line, we help guide people to make sustainable choices, creating a first of its kind positive feedback loop.

Note: This is not a paid position, however, students are encouraged to apply for a stipend/payment through their College or University. Most accredited programs in the US have internal funding to support internships. We also do not provide accommodation. If intending to work in person, please ensure you are interested in an internship in New York City under these circumstances before applying.

position: Exciting Business Marketing Internship at Sports AI Start-Up Fall 2021
description:
Full Job Description

Sparrow is an early-stage startup that uses artificial intelligence (AI) to help athletes improve.

We are offering a valuable Business Marketing Spring internship for a bright, motivated, resourceful college student or recent college graduate looking to learn the ins and outs of the startup, A.I., and sports worlds.

You’ll work closely with the company’s serial-entrepreneur CEO & core business marketing team to strategize and execute the 2021 agenda, including:

  • Sparrow's app store launch
  • Email marketing campaigns
  • User feedback communication
  • Data analytics system
  • Social media presence (including content creation)
  • Public relations
  • Influencer outreach
  • And much more!

Person sought must:

  • Be a student at or a recent graduate of a reputable 4-year college, with either a business, communications or marketing related degree and/or experience
  • Be able to work an 8 hour work day (~40 hours per week) end of August through end of December 2021 or longer
  • Be uber-productive, able to switch between different kinds of tasks, and comfortable taking on all jobs complex or mundane.
  • Be experienced and comfortable using online tools like G Suite, email marketing platforms and social media outlets like Youtube, Instagram, and Twitter.
  • Be very detail-oriented and thoughtful when executing a task or initiative
  • Be able to figure out how things work, or how to get things done when a solution isn’t obvious or involves multiple steps or tools

This position represents a unique opportunity to:

  • Work closely with the company founders, successful serial entrepreneurs who have started numerous companies, raised over $20 million in venture capital for them, and have 2 successful exits. (check out our founders here: https://youtu.be/r82gufgzltg)
  • Learn the ins-and-outs of running a startup with tremendous potential that is just getting started
  • Receive a $50 weekly stipend, college credit and potentially earn an equity bonus (stock options), and more importantly gain relationships in the tech, AI, and sports industry

Testimonials from Sparrow’s Intern Classes

Full Job Description
IT & Security Intern (remote role)
Thought Industries

Who We Are:
The IT & Information Security Team is responsible for building, maintaining, and securing the organization’s corporate & application infrastructure. It is our job to ensure systems are implemented to industry best practices/adhere to industry compliance frameworks and that the business has what it needs to function efficiently. This position reports to the Manager of IT & Information Security. It is a lead role and the candidate will be a key contributor to the success of the Thought Industries IT & Security department.

The Opportunity:
The IT & Information Security Team is seeking an individual who is working towards earning their bachelor's degree in any technical discipline related to information technology. This opportunity will provide a wide range of exposure to industry frameworks and best practices in the management of IT & security infrastructure within a corporate environment.

Why this job is important:
The IT & Security Intern is a key role that contributes to the day-to-day operational success of the IT & Information Security Team here at Thought Industries. They are the first point of contact for addressing all IT & Security related items. Under the guidance of the Manager of IT & Information Security, the candidate will have gained extensive knowledge and experience with how information technology is an operational pillar of any business.

Responsibilities:
Managing the help desk queue and response to IT tickets.
Aid in the completion of IT & Security Team projects.
Monitor and respond to any identified security alerts.
Manage the initial response to customer RFP/Security Questionnaires.
Assist in the provisioning and deprovisioning of IT assets.

Qualifications:
You are a quick learner with strong analytical and problem-solving skills.
Ability to support both Mac & PC.
You are well organized, detail oriented, and hold superb time management skills.
You have excellent communication and interpersonal skills.
You have the aptitude to work in a fast paced team environment.
Strong interest in expanding your knowledge and desire to grow is a must.

Bonus points for:
Any CompTIA+ Certifications.
Knowledge of Cloud based technologies, more specifically AWS.
Knowledge of SOC 2, ISO:27001, PCI or other industry frameworks.

ABOUT OUR COMPANY
At Thought Industries we’re helping businesses change the way they approach customer education and external training. Whether they’re working to onboard clients to their product or establish themselves as a Thought Leader or deliver certifications to a field of interest, our industry leading platform and team of SMEs are there to take your initiative further.

We are a private equity-backed company with employees distributed through the U.S. as well as employees in Canada and Ireland. As a people-first organization with a flexible, fun, hard working environment, we have a wide variety of benefits and culture perks to offer each employee.

Datix is a rapidly growing software consulting services company based in St. Louis, MO with clients throughout North America. description:
Full Job Description
Location: 33 S 6th St, Minneapolis, Minnesota, United States, 55402-3601

This job posting is intended for Target’s summer interns to apply for consideration for a full time position aligning to their internship program. If you were not a summer intern with Target your application will not be considered for this job posting.

Target is an iconic brand, a Fortune 50 company and one of America’s leading retailers.

Target as a tech company? Absolutely. We’re the behind-the-scenes powerhouse that fuels Target’s passion and commitment to cutting-edge innovation. We anchor every facet of one of the world’s best-loved retailers with a strong technology framework that relies on the latest tools and technologies—and the brightest people—to deliver incredible value to guests online and in stores. Target Technology Services is on a mission to offer the systems, tools and support that guests and team members need and deserve. Our high-performing teams balance independence with collaboration, and we pride ourselves on being versatile, agile and creative. We drive industry-leading technologies in support of every angle of the business, and help ensure that Target operates smoothly, securely and reliably from the inside out.

Implement engineering solutions for data-driven applications

Communicate and partner with other engineering team members

Review code developed by team

Keep abreast of advances in technology

Participation In Target's summer internship

description:

Every year, we welcome thousands of university students from every corner of the world to join Microsoft. You bring your aspirations, talent, potential—and excitement for the journey ahead.

At Microsoft, Interns work on real-world projects in collaboration with teams across the world, while having fun along the way. You’ll be empowered to build community, explore your passions and achieve your goals. This is your chance to bring your solutions and ideas to life while working on cutting-edge technology. The internship is designed not only for you to do great work with the opportunity to learn and grow, but to experience our culture full of diverse community connection, executive engagement, and memorable events.

We’re a company of learn-it-alls rather than know-it-alls and our culture is centered around embracing a growth mindset, a theme of inspiring excellence, and encouraging teams and leaders to bring their best each day. Does this sound like you? Learn more about our cultural attributes.

Are you ready to join us and create the future? Come as you are, do what you love—start your journey with us today!

Responsibilities

Software engineers (SWEs) work with teammates to solve problems and build innovative software solutions. You are passionate about customers and product quality, and you provide technical guidance to Program Managers as they consider user needs and product requirements. You will also be expected to demonstrate an ability to learn and adopt relevant new technologies, tools, methods and processes to leverage in your solutions. As a SWE, you are dedicated to design, development and testing of next-generation software which will empower every person and organization on the planet to achieve more.

Applies engineering principles to solve complex problems through sound and creative engineering.
Quickly learns new engineering methods and incorporates them into his or her work processes.
Seeks feedback and applies internal or industry best practices to improve his or her technical solutions.
Demonstrates skill in time management and completing software projects in a cooperative team environment.
Qualifications
Pursuing a bachelor's or master's degree in engineering, computer science or related field.
Must have at least one additional quarter/semester of school remaining following the completion of the internship.
One year of programming experience in an object-oriented language.
Ability to demonstrate an understanding of computer science fundamentals, including data structures and algorithms.

Visit our Careers FAQ Page to learn more about the interview process and answers to commonly asked questions.

Microsoft is an equal opportunity employer. This will be a great opportunity for a self-motivated student interested in cybersecurity and IOT to learn more about POWER’s Protection and Controls services. Full Job Description

Media Island is a Digital Marketing agency specializing in the international tourism industry, specifically with Central American tourism agencies. We work on campaigns highly targeted to Miami, FL, and surrounding areas to increase our clients' branding and to improve their client acquisition processes.

We are currently recruiting an intern for a Website Design Internship position with strong experience in web design skills. All student candidates must be currently enrolled in a college, university, or technical school. for the fall 2021 semester. This will be an unpaid internship for college credit.

Candidates should display strong written and verbal communication skills, as well as an eagerness to learn. Bi-lingual in Spanish and English preferred, but not required. You must know how to code, design, and know API integration.

Students will be asked to intern at least twenty-four hours a week but we will do our best to work with your schedule.

Job Description: The Website Design intern will assist in creating the look, layout, and features of our client's websites. The position involves understanding both graphic design and computer programming. The designer helps with maintenance and additions to the website. They work with development teams and managers for keeping the site up-to-date and prioritizing needs, among other tasks.

Prior Experience with the following software is preferred:

· HTML5

· InVision

· Adobe Creative Suite

· WordPress

· JavaScript

· Click Funnels

Skills & Key Qualifications:

  • Cut down our offer creation-to-launch time
  • Data-driven & decisive decision-making skills
  • Ambitious and highly motivated to perform at the highest level
  • Quickly gain a deep understanding of our brand, programs, and clients
  • Prioritizes actions & tests based on the easiest levers to pull with the biggest results
  • Able to quickly generate a responsive & full-stack funnel, with ideal/correct UX & UI
  • In-depth knowledge of Clickfunnels and “Funnel Hacking”
  • Strong understanding of all areas of digital marketing- SEO, Ads placement, email marketing, automation sequences, etc.
  • Create an A/B Testing SOP to test 1 variable per week (minimum) per offer/funnel with reliable tracking metrics (UTMs)
  • Monitors funnel changes, duplications, and tests so that they remain stable throughout the new offer launches and updates to existing funnel flows
  • Able to troubleshoot, identify, and fix any Clickfunnel issues

Requirements

  • Willing to try, not afraid to fail: You need a willingness to learn and master unfamiliar skills. We operate in a unique, non-traditional way and require you to adapt to our operations. We are after learning and embrace that failure is a part of that process.
  • Seeking constant self-improvement: We strive to be an organization where the best ideas succeed. We communicate and operate transparently. We strive for continuous evolution and do not shy from giving honest feedback for the greater good of the organization. You must be open to receiving and giving feedback for the greater good of the company.
  • Work hard, play hard mentality: Our primary responsibility is taking care of our clients. You must be willing to get the job done.
  • Ability to work 24+ hours/week: This will be a remote position.

Qualifications

  • Bachelors degree preferred in Computer Science, Web Design or related fields.
  • 2+ years of prior experience in website design and managing websites.
  • Prior experience at a digital marketing agency.
  • Strong knowledge of social media trends and the competitive landscape of digital marketing.
  • Conversational and written fluency in Spanish is strongly preferred.
  • Excellent time-management, organization, and communication skills.
  • Ability to work effectively under pressure and balance priorities.
  • Strong analytic skills.
  • Proficient in Excel, PowerPoint, and Word.

The fall 2021 Website Design internship at Media Island is an incredible way to get experience working within a digital marketing agency. All applicants must be available to start as soon as possible.

Work Remotely:

Full Job Description
Overview:
An intern position, in the Software Design Group, at General Dynamics Ordnance and Tactical Systems, offers you the opportunity to be continually challenged and immersed in a software design & test environment. You will have access to the latest tools, hardware, and some of the brightest software engineers in this area. We are about supporting the warfighter. We are about developing advanced rotary cannons, high speed ammunition handling systems, gun turrets, crew served weapons and other electro-mechanical technologies. Of which, software is an integral part of our weaponry. Our products can be found with every U.S. military branch and with allies around the world.

You as the latest member of our team will contribute to the design and development of many future military armament systems. Come join our incredible team and know that you will be making a difference in the mission of our warfighter.

position: Exciting AI/iOS Development Internship with Sports AI Startup Fall 2021
description:
Full Job Description

Sparrow is an early-stage startup that uses artificial intelligence (A.I.) to help athletes improve. We are offering an exciting full time 4+ month internship for a talented, motivated college student or recent graduate looking to learn the ins and outs of the A.I., computer vision, start-up and sports worlds.

In this role, you’ll work closely with Sparrow’s technical co-founder Dr. Todd Eaglin as the company drives towards the launch of its consumer facing sports app.

Be part of the talented team that is harnessing the full power of the phone (onboard processing and AI capabilities, multiple cameras, Lidar, etc) to open up a new market - personalized AI-guided coaching.

You will get the opportunity to work in different areas of computer vision and A.I., including:

- Pose estimation

- Training of neural networks

- Keyframe identification

- Action recognition

Person sought must:

1. Be a masters or undergraduate student at a reputable college, working towards a computer science related degree (or have comparable experience)

2. Be able to work full time through September-December 2021 (end of semester)

3. Be knowledgeable working with Python, C++ and machine learning tools like tensorflow.

4. Be uber-productive, able to switch between different kinds of tasks, and comfortable taking on all jobs complex or mundane.

5. Be detail-oriented and thoughtful when executing a task or initiative

6. Be able to figure out how things work, or how to get things done when a solution isn’t obvious or involves multiple steps or tools

This position represents a unique opportunity to:

- work closely with the company founders, successful serial entrepreneurs who have started numerous companies, raised over $20 million in venture capital for them, and have 2 successful exits. (check out our founders here: https://youtu.be/r82gufgzltg)

- learn the ins-and-outs of running a startup with tremendous potential that is just getting started

- although unpaid, you will receive a weekly stipend, college credit, equity / stock options in the company. And gain invaluable relationships in the tech, AI, and sports industry

position: Sr AI Engineer - Summer 2021 Interns Only
description:
Full Job Description
Location: 33 S 6th St, Minneapolis, Minnesota, United States, 55402-3601

This job posting is intended for Target’s summer interns to apply for consideration for a full time position aligning to their internship program. If you were not a summer intern with Target your application will not be considered for this job posting.

Target is looking for Senior Engineers to help us build Artificial Intelligence infrastructure to optimize Target's supply chain.
Our Target Technology partners provide us with a wide variety of services: databases, queues, metrics platforms, compute schedulers, etc. We'd love to hear from you if you are interested in helping us support a team of AI scientists in trying to use these services to scale their AI algorithms to help us efficiently move products through Target's supply chain.

Our goal is that when a Guest walks into a Target store, the things they are hoping to buy are ready to buy, and we got it there efficiently.

As a Senior AI Engineer, You will:
Work with business partners, data scientists, and engineers in a highly interactive and integrated environment to build the future of Target's supply chain and engineer solutions.

Work on a global team using modern technologies such as Slack, GitHub, Skype.

Use modern technologies like Kubernetes, Nix, Rust, Haskell, Python, in domains like combinatorial optimization, operations research, and end-to-end versioned data pipelines.

Work directly with all our team members, on all our active projects. We like to expose everybody to everything and expect people to be picking up new technologies as needed to be helpful on our wide variety of projects.

Spend 20% of your time on self-directed self-enrichment. We believe very seriously that everybody needs to be given time and space to grow themselves in whatever way they see fit, and we expect you to spend work hours doing so.

Requirements:
Participation In Target's summer internship

Working towards a graduate degree in computer science, computer engineering or related discipline

Experience in one or more of C++, Java, Scala, Python or equivalent programming language

Understanding of advanced data structures and algorithms

Familiarity with linear algebra, statistics, information theory or related mathematical domains

Understand deep learning, dynamic programming, reinforcement learning or related areas

Ability to develop and execute processes for complete CI/CD pipeline

Excellent written and verbal communication skills

Preferred Requirements:
Interest in site-reliability. We are building distributed systems at scale. We know this is hard! We are looking for engineers that are excited by the challenge.

Understanding of systems topics such as cluster computing, schedulers, build systems, databases, etc.

Interest in modern infrastructure systems such as Kubernetes, Nomad, Mesos, Consul, Kafka, etc.

Experience operating persistent storage systems like relational databases, key-value stores, and object storage

Why work with us at Target?

We are using great tools. Not only are we using programming languages like Haskell, Rust, Scala, and Python, but we are also using modern tooling and infrastructure like Nix, Kubernetes, and Kafka.

We love open source! Many of our team member's contribute to open source communities and get to do it during work time. We try to contribute back to our communities where we can and are grateful to be able to open source some of our own projects!

We value diversity. We believe that diversity and inclusion is of core importance when try to create positive in-store experiences for our guests, and we think it is also critically important when building our teams. Read more about our commitment to diversity and inclusion

We value our team members. We treat out team members like people, not like cogs in a machine. We value our team members for who they are, not just what they can get done. We are parents, hobbyists, enthusiasts, family members, and community members, and can offer flexibility to our team members' schedules and work arrangements so that they can flourish both inside and outside of work.

Americans with Disabilities Act (ADA)

Target will provide reasonable accommodations (such as a qualified sign language interpreter or other personal assistance) with the application process upon your request as required to comply with applicable laws. If you have a disability and require assistance in this application process, please visit your nearest Target store or Distribution Center or reach out to Guest Services at 1-800-440-0680 for additional information.

Full Job Description
No Relocation Assistance Offered
# 109820 - Piscataway, New Jersey, United States

The Experience

Colgate-Palmolive invites you to apply for the Fall 2021 Application & Software Development Internship for the Global Information Technology (GIT) organization. Our program provides Interns with the opportunity to work with a global and diverse workforce as well as apply their conceptual knowledge of business and technical skills within a global consumer products company. Throughout our program, Interns will gain valuable work experience and exposure to the latest business practices and groundbreaking technologies. Additionally, Interns will function as integral team members throughout the development life cycle by working with business and technical analysts to evaluate issues, develop solutions, implement processes, and support existing applications.

Essentially, the program is a structured education strategy integrating the students’ academic knowledge and career goals with learning through productive work experiences in a sphere related specifically to Global Information Technology. In this 6-month program, you will join the Global Technology team and work on a few applications supporting our Clinical and Claims business processes including the interface between our Claims system and our Data Warehouse, our Clinical electronic data capture tool, and an interface to provide package content to our artwork suppliers. All of these solutions will be hosted on GCP and written using a combination of Python and JavaScript.

Who are you?

You are a collaborator- In this role, Interns get opportunities to network with multiple cross-functional teams. These relationships flourish with mutual trust and integrity to achieve deliverables and execute against the strategy and goals.

You are an innovator- You look for opportunities to improve and seek creative solutions and you’re able to adapt and adjust the strategy and direction of your work if necessary.

You are curious- You’re curious about what works and what does not and are willing to take the initiative to find out.

What you’ll need (requirements)

Must currently be enrolled in a Bachelor’s degree program at a college or university

Majoring in Computer Science, Information Technology, Computer Engineering, Business/ IT Systems Management, or a related field

A minimum GPA of 2.8

Documentation of authorization to work in the United States, not requiring visa sponsorship now or in the future

Technical knowledge and skills, completed course work, projects, or relevant work related experience

Must be available to work a minimum of 15-20 hours per week

Familiarity with Python and JavaScript programming languages and web-related technologies

Equal Opportunity Employer
Colgate is an equal opportunity employer and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, national origin, ethnicity, age, disability, marital status, veteran status (United States positions), or any other characteristic protected by law.

Are you interested in working for Colgate-Palmolive? You can apply online and attach all relevant documents such as a cover letter and resume or CV. Applications received by e-mail are not considered in the selection process. Become part of our team. We look forward to your application.

Colgate-Palmolive is a leading global consumer products company, tightly focused on Oral Care, Personal Care, Home Care and Pet Nutrition. Colgate sells its products in over 200 countries and territories around the world under such internationally recognised brand names as Colgate, Palmolive, elmex, Tom’s of Maine, Sorriso, Speed Stick, Lady Speed Stick, Softsoap, Irish Spring, Protex, Sanex, Elta MD, PCA Skin, Ajax, Axion, Fabuloso, Soupline and Suavitel, as well as Hill’s Science Diet and Hill’s Prescription Diet.

For more information about Colgate’s global business, visit the Company’s web site at http://www.colgatepalmolive.com. To learn more about Colgate Bright Smiles, Bright Futures® oral health education programme, please visit http://www.colgatebsbf.com. To learn more about Hill's and the Hill’s Food, Shelter & Love program please visit http://www.hillspet.com. To learn more about Tom’s of Maine please visit http://www.tomsofmaine.com.

Reasonable accommodation during the application process is available for persons with disabilities. Please contact Application_Accommodation@colpal.com with the subject "Accommodation Request" should you require accommodation.

Full Job Description
MAKE A DIFFERENCE AT OCHIN!

OCHIN is a rapidly growing national nonprofit health IT organization with two decades of experience transforming health care delivery to drive health equity. We are hiring for a number of new positions to meet increasing demand. When you choose to join OCHIN, you have the opportunity to continuously grow your skills and do meaningful work to help fulfill our mission.

OCHIN provides leading-edge technology, data analytics, research, and support services to more than 500 community health care sites, reaching nearly 6 million patients nationally. We believe that every individual, no matter their race, ethnicity, background, or zip code, should have fair opportunity to achieve their full health potential. Our work addresses differences in health that are systemic, avoidable, and unjust. We partner, learn, innovate, and advocate, in order to close the gap in health for individuals and communities negatively impacted by racism or other structural inequities.

At OCHIN, we value the unique perspectives and experiences of every individual and work hard to maintain a culture of belonging.

Founded in Oregon in 2000, OCHIN employs a growing virtual workforce of more than 500 diverse professionals, working remotely across 40+ states. We offer a generous compensation package and are committed to supporting our employees’ entire well-being by fostering a healthy work-life balance and equitable opportunity for professional advancement. We are curious, collaborative learners who strive to live our values everyday: leadership, collaboration, excellence, innovation, inclusion, and stewardship. OCHIN is excited to support our continued national expansion and the increasing demand for our innovative tools and services by welcoming new talent to our growing team.

This is an hourly paid position at $15 per hour for undergrad and $16 per hour for graduate level students.Training will be provided by OCHIN.

Performs service desk functions, responds to ticket inquiries, records, documents, and troubleshoots customer issues.
Performs duties associated with setup, configuration and installation of system software products and peripheral equipment.
Programs and troubleshoots computer software and hardware. Identifies, logs, and resolves problems related to supported applications.
Assists in analyzing, evaluating, and recommending techniques for implementation of new software applications and computer equipment.
Assists in updates and maintenance of technology used by OCHIN Staff
Performs all other related duties as assigned.

Qualifications

Must be currently enrolled in an accredited bachelor’s or master’s degree program.
Experience working with IT, customer support or technical support.
Must have the ability to interact professionally and effectively with individuals at all levels of the organization.
Excellent written and oral communication skills and experience with superior attention to detail.
Experience with MS Office Suite, some knowledge of Smartsheet, Microsoft Teams & Zoom
Experience thriving in a fast-paced environment.

Work Location and Travel Requirements

This position is 100% remote. Work from home requirements are:
Ability to work independently and efficiently from a home office environment
High Speed Internet Service
It is a requirement that employees work in a distraction free workplace
Travel may be required based on business requirements for OCHIN

position: Linux Graphics Automated Testing Intern - Spring 2022
description:
Full Job Description
NVIDIA's invention of the GPU in 1999 fueled the growth of the PC gaming market, redefined modern computer graphics, and revolutionized parallel computing. More recently, GPU deep learning ignited modern AI — the next era of computing — with the GPU acting as the brain of computers, robots, and self-driving cars that can perceive and understand the world. Today, we are increasingly known as “the AI computing company”. We are growing our company and the team with the smartest people in the world.

Would you like to learn about the state-of-the-art Linux graphics software used in professional and consumer applications and how it is automatically tested to ensure high quality and have good knowledge of Linux and Python? If so, you are a phenomenal fit for our team! We would love to hear from you.

We are now looking for a Linux Graphics Automated Testing Intern.

What you’ll be doing:
Improve software to automate the testing of our Linux driver on new and existing NVIDIA GPU products.

Improve existing tooling for monitoring performance of gaming and workstation test cases.

Work with other engineers to identify processes to be improved with automation.

You will be using modern technologies with the latest hardware.

What we need to see:
Currently pursuing a Degree in Computer Science, or related field.

You are comfortable working in Linux command-line environments.

Strong understanding of modern Python development.

Strong communication skills and good team spirit.

Familiarity with Git or similar revision control software.

Ways to stand out from the crowd:
You are an avid Linux user looking to improve the Linux Gaming experience.

Previous experience with Linux System Administration.

Familiarity with statistical analysis tools for identifying and isolating out-of-bound behavior.

NVIDIA is committed to fostering a diverse work environment and proud to be an equal opportunity employer. Full Job Description
2021 Internship: IT

OFFICE LOCATION: New York City

Organization Overview

REFORM Alliance is a national organization seeking to safely reduce the number of people on probation and parole and create real pathways to work and wellness for people who have been supervised instead of supported. In 2021 our focus is on state and federal probation and parole policy reform.

REFORM was launched in 2019 by award-winning recording artist Meek Mill; Philadelphia 76ers co-owner and Fanatics executive chairman Michael Rubin; Arnold Ventures co-founder Laura Arnold; entrepreneur and business mogul Shawn “JAY-Z” Carter; Kraft Group CEO and New England Patriots owner Robert Kraft; Galaxy Digital CEO and founder Michael E. Novogratz; Vista Equity Partners founder, chairman, CEO Robert F. Smith, Brooklyn Nets co-owner and philanthropic investor Clara Wu Tsai; and CNN host and activist Van Jones.

We are using all the resources we have to help fix the flawed criminal justice system in the United States by changing laws and policies, and building a movement of REFORMers to help change hearts and minds.

2021 IT Internship Program Overview

REFORM is seeking candidates for our 2021 summer internship program. The ideal candidate for the IT internship is a college or graduate student in IT, computer science or engineering; is passionate about criminal justice reform; and is a self-starter who is eager to learn in a team environment.

We want to ensure that our group of 2021 summer interns includes people who have lived experience with the justice system. People who have been directly impacted by or involved with the justice system are encouraged to apply, to identify in their application that they have lived experience, and to share any details about that experience that they feel comfortable sharing.

The IT internship is an opportunity to grow the intern’s knowledge of their chosen field of IT - as well as the intern’s exposure to the power of storytelling and the fight to reform the justice system. This is a non-exempt position and students receive an hourly rate, exposure to leaders in this space and company initiatives, and the opportunity to build transferable business skills. Projects are designed to build knowledge, skills, and professional experience.

The IT Internship will start as soon as possible and last up to eight weeks. The Intern will work and participate in internship activities from 9:00 a.m. to 2:00 p.m. Monday through Thursday. Interns will be paid $15/hour for 20 hours/week.

PROJECTS AND RESPONSIBILITIES

The Intern: IT will shadow and support the IT Coordinator in managing facilities and IT operations in our New York and Washington DC offices. The intern will have exposure to leadership and staff at REFORM.

Specific Duties

Help the IT Coordinator to maintain daily office operations. Serve as a point person for staff for anything related to office systems, including building-related logistics, IT support & supplies requests.
Assist the IT Coordinator with employee onboarding; provision workstations for new employees; ensure new employees are set up on printers and with vendors, have keys or access cards as applicable; order business cards.
Deployment of new software on employee workstations via scripts or scheduled tasks in REFORM’s mobile device management system.
Provide support related to new software or tasks asked by the Administrative Team.
Ensure a positive guest experience.
Provide assistance to the IT Coordinator in the administration of online accounts - Emails, Meraki Mobile device management, Vmware Carbon Black, Cisco Umbrella, Zoom, et al. - Assign (and remove) users where applicable, keep account payment method updated, keep active user lists current, help to troubleshoot user issues.
Provide assistance to the IT Coordinator in the preparation of meeting room technology in advance to ensure smooth internal and external meetings. Take appropriate steps to ensure teleconferencing and video conferencing run smoothly. Assist staff with sending meeting invitations for sensitive or tech-focused meetings.
Provide IT and User Support relating to technical issues involving Microsoft’s core business applications and Operating Systems and Google Workspace and other software, hardware and applications - including onsite and remote user support.
Other tasks as assigned.

REFORM’s stakeholders, including its Board members, guests, and employees, are very important to REFORM’s identity and success. The IT Coordinator is responsible for ensuring these stakeholders have a consistent, smooth, and positive experience and impression of REFORM. By shadowing and supporting the IT Coordinator, the Intern: IT will contribute to the REFORM team and overall mission.

QUALIFICATIONS

Qualifications for Interns are as follows:
Be pursuing a bachelor/graduate degree in IT, computer science or engineering at an accredited institution.

Have a cumulative GPA of 3.0 or above

Ability to work in a team setting as well as independently with minimal supervision. Provide your own laptop.

Strong interest in our mission.

Reliable, passionate, organized and possess excellent analytical and interpersonal skills.

Preferred:
Coursework in Cybersecurity and data protection

Eligibility requirements:
Must be 18 years of age or older

Employment/education will be verified

Must be currently authorized to work in the United States

At REFORM Alliance, we strive to move hearts and minds to create a more humane criminal justice system. This requires us to maintain a company culture that values employee individuality and community development. We are committed to fostering an environment that is inclusive, empowering and globally minded. We firmly believe that diversity in gender, race, ethnicity, sexual identity, cultural background, religion, disability and age produces ideas and perspectives that make our efforts stronger for people unjustly in the system and make our company a better place to work. Our leadership team is committed to embedding diversity and inclusion into everything we do and how we lead.

Full Job Description
LinkUp is a Minneapolis-based job search engine with a singular vision of delivering perfect job market information to our clients and users. We do this through proprietary and sophisticated technology that allows us to index millions of jobs directly from company websites around the world every day. We’re the global leader in delivering accurate, real-time, and predictive job market data and analytics. Every day we index millions of global job openings directly from employer websites and deliver that data to clients across industries and around the world to help them assess labor demand, understand trends, predict job growth and decline, and so much more.

We are seeking an individual who will be a key contributor to our data management team to support the ongoing growth of the company.

About the role
You'll work as part of a fun team, using your growing skillset to help us scour the internet to build the world's best index of job opportunities and job market data.

Location
Typically, this position is located at our office in downtown Minneapolis with opportunities for remote work. Due to COVID-19, this position may start as work-from-home exclusively. We're currently discussing back-to-office plans, vaccination requirements, and et cetera with clarification to come further along in the process. As such, you'll want to make sure the following are available to you:

A relatively distraction-free environment to work in
Reliable internet connection for working and participating in video meetings

While not strictly required, we're heavily favoring candidates more local to the area. At this time, we cannot facilitate candidates who are international/require a work visa/et cetera. Equipment to work on will be provided to you. For security reasons, you will not be permitted to work from your own PC/laptop/device.

Compensation
This is a paid internship ideal for non-traditional students working on a technical degree. The pay is $20 per hour and planned to be about 20 hours per week. Since this is a part-time internship, the role does not meet the requirements to be benefits-eligible for health/dental benefits, vacation, holiday pay, or 401K plan participation.

Length of Internship
This posting is for a 5–7 month internship position.

To be successful, you'll need the following

Working towards a degree (or equivalent experience) in computer science or related field
Some experience programming in one or more modern programming languages (you'll learn PHP here if you don't already know it)
A baseline understanding of web technologies and protocols
Strong communication and interpersonal skills
The ability to work collaboratively or independently

Someone that would be a great fit

Gets excited about metrics and analytics
Loves to write code and manipulate data
Sees data in everything and wants to take things apart and tinker
Has a natural tendency to automate and streamline things
Has a habit of setting measurable goals and blowing past them
Knows the importance of clean, consistent, documented code
Can read and understand code written by other people
Loves being a critical part of a team doing meaningful work

A little bit about us
We take pride in a great company culture that is based on our core principles: work hard, have fun, think big, solve problems, and do good. To be blunt (and brag a bit), LinkUp is a great company filled with outstanding people that are incredibly talented, extremely dedicated, and really fun to work with. Along with some of our office perks such as stand-up desks, scooters, volunteer opportunities, and free snacks, we offer competitive pay, health / dental benefits, paid time off, 401k, and employee stock options.

description:
Full Job Description
