Description
At BASF, we create chemistry through the power of connected minds. By balancing economic success with environmental protection and social responsibility, we are building a more sustainable future through chemistry. As the world’s leading chemical company, we help our customers in nearly every industry meet the current and future needs of society through science and innovation. We provide a challenging and rewarding work environment with a strong emphasis on process safety, as well as the safety of our employees and the communities we operate in and are always working to form the best team—especially from within, through an emphasis on lifelong learning and development.
We are constantly striving to become an even better place to work. BASF has been recognized by Forbes Magazine as one of America's Best Large Employers in 2021 and for the ninth consecutive year, BASF was named one of the Top 50 Companies for Diversity by DiversityInc, moving up two places from 14 in 2020 to 12 in 2021. BASF was also recognized as a Top Company for Environmental, Social & Governance (ESG) for its corporate social responsibility and philanthropic programs, practices and investments. Come join us on our journey to create solutions for a sustainable future!
Professional Development Program (PDP) Internship – Data Science Summer 2022 BASF's Data Science Summer Internship is created to provide highly motivated, mobile-minded current university students an opportunity to enhance their professional skills through a variety of diverse learning experiences. Participants will contribute to leading-edge data science projects and will be guided to apply data science skills in a real-world setting. Where the Chemistry Happens… You start as an intern in a leading-edge team with expertise in Data Science, Statistics, and Operations Research - Advanced Business Analytics (ABA). Advanced Business Analytics co-creates and delivers innovative data-driven solutions for better business decisions through mathematical modeling. These solutions are developed and delivered in collaboration with all business and functional units (including Procurement, Production, Supply Chain, Planning & Controlling, Marketing & Sales, and Finance).
Responsible for leveraging mathematics to propel paradigm shifts across the entire company, the Intern will support the initiation, execution, and completion of projects in the areas of Data Science, Artificial Intelligence, and Optimization to increase business profitability and reduce costs.
The Intern will be ‘hands-on’ and work on projects to execute deliverables during all phases of an analytics project, starting from project definition to completion. Deliverables will include the development of the appropriate mathematical models, collaborating with members from other functions to gather and validate the necessary data, and presenting the project results and benefits to key stake holders and internal clients. Also, communicating the ideas and solutions of advanced business analytics to a broad community of non-mathematicians and acting as a driving force in international and interdisciplinary project teams will be a key success-factor.

Program Summary:
As a highly motivated undergraduate student, you will participate in a summer internship program at one of BASF’s North American sites
Utilizing your experience in your area of study, you will help complete various data science projects which will provide the opportunity to further develop both technical and professional skills
Create Your Own Chemistry: What We Offer You… We offer students the opportunity to spend a summer working at a North American BASF site within the U.S. to apply their education and background to challenging assignments that build both technical and professional skills. Our PDP internship is a precursor to our rotational programs, which combine hands-on experience with unparalleled networking and development opportunities designed to accelerate your career at BASF.
Enhanced career development and the opportunity to explore possible career tracks within the company
Development of your expertise and the ability to network at senior levels throughout BASF and establish mentoring relationships that could span across your whole career
The opportunity for consideration of future opportunities within the organization including the Full-time Data Science Professional Development Program To learn more about our programs, please visit www.basf.com/universitycareers .
Qualifications - BASF recognizes institutions of Higher Education which are accredited by the Council for Higher Education Accreditation or equivalent

Formula for Success:
Undergraduate students majoring in Applied Mathematics, Computer Science, Computer Engineering, Data Science, Software Engineering, Statistics, Chemical Engineering, or related field
Authorization to work in the U.S. now and in the future without restrictions or need for future sponsorship
College Juniors preferred (May 2023 - July 2023 grads)
Demonstrated academic achievement (Minimum GPA 3.2)
Commitment to relocate anywhere in the U.S.
Programming experience in R and Python, other languages a plus
Strong analytical skills
Fast learner
Motivated to learn about machine learning, artificial intelligence, big data, and new technologies
Active participation in extracurricular activities and on-campus organizations
Previous internship/co-op experience is a plus

Full Job Description
As a valued member of Cognyte's Video Intelligence Solutions, Technical Support team, you will be responsible for advanced troubleshooting and working to resolve service requests escalated to you. In addition, you will be the first point of contact for customer service inquiries received via the telephone, email, or the customer’s ticketing system. You will be responsible for creating service requests in the Oracle Customer Relationship Management (CRM) application, verifying eligibility for support, troubleshooting, and escalating any unresolved issues by standard escalation procedures. You will also monitor the progress of a service request from its creation to its completion. In addition, you will be responsible for closing the request by the documented process.

Principal Duties and Essential Responsibilities:
  • Responds to a moderate volume of service inquiries within focused verticals, either by phone, email, or the customer’s ticketing system, gathering information about the customer, contacts, eligibility for support, and install-base data. Utilizes this information to create service requests in the Oracle CRM database.
  • Works closely with team members to resolve service requests that have been escalated. Ensures follow-up and detailed feedback are provided.
  • Assesses nature of the problem; Utilizes technical expertise, exercises judgment and decision making to perform troubleshooting to resolve the issue. Works with peers when appropriate to assist in resolving issues.
  • Works with 3rd party hardware manufacturers to open service requests and troubleshoot their hardware remotely.
  • Works with 3rd party vendors to dispatch them for on-site support when required.
  • Processes RMA’s for hardware when required.
  • For more complex issues, escalates issues to the appropriate technical support personnel for resolution.
  • Gains understanding of how the issue was resolved and applied knowledge to future service inquiries.
  • Follows the progress of requests to ensure requests are resolved promptly and that the customer is delighted with the resolution.
  • Closes requests when completed.
  • Performs various administrative and reporting tasks as assigned.
  • Assists in training new employees.
  • Adheres to written or verbally communicated processes.
Minimum Requirements:
  • Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, and/or equivalent work experience.
  • 0-1+ years of technical support experience, preferably in a call center environment.
  • Excellent customer service and phone etiquette skills.
  • Demonstrable troubleshooting skills, organization, and analytical skills.
  • Excellent problem-solving skills and attention to detail.
  • Strong verbal and written communication skills.
  • Proven ability to manage multiple tasks with shifting priorities and timeframes.
  • Works well in and supports a team environment.
  • Ability to take direction, retain information, and apply in similar situations.
  • Strong computer skills, including MS Word, Excel, Outlook, Windows Operating Systems.
  • Willingness to work a flexible schedule, including evenings and weekends, if needed.
  • Successful completion of a background screening process including, but not limited to, employment verifications, criminal search, OFAC, SS Verification, as well as credit and drug screening, where applicable and following federal and local regulations.
Preferred Requirements:
  • Formal trouble ticketing system and/or Oracle CRM application experience.
  • Technical training/education and/or certifications highly desirable.
  • Basic understanding of network architecture.
  • Microsoft SQL database support and maintenance.
  • Computer hardware knowledge, including experience with hardware replacement.
  • Basic understanding of Raid Technology, Windows 7 and/or 10, 2008/2012 server knowledge.
  • Understanding system logs and event logs.
This is an intern position - Background check and citizenship as requirements.

The Experience

Colgate-Palmolive invites you to apply for the Fall 2021 Application & Software Development Internship for the Global Information Technology (GIT) organization. Our program provides Interns with the opportunity to work with a global and diverse workforce as well as apply their conceptual knowledge of business and technical skills within a global consumer products company. Throughout our program, Interns will gain valuable work experience and exposure to the latest business practices and groundbreaking technologies. Additionally, Interns will function as integral team members throughout the development life cycle by working with business and technical analysts to evaluate issues, develop solutions, implement processes, and support existing applications.

Essentially, the program is a structured education strategy integrating the students’ academic knowledge and career goals with learning through productive work experiences in a sphere related specifically to Global Information Technology. In this 6-month program, you will join the Global Technology team and work on a few applications supporting our Clinical and Claims business processes including the interface between our Claims system and our Data Warehouse, our Clinical electronic data capture tool, and an interface to provide package content to our artwork suppliers. All of these solutions will be hosted on GCP and written using a combination of Python and JavaScript.

AMPLY is a fast-growing 2020 Global CleanTech 100 company, honored for innovation in Electric Vehicle Fleet Charging and Management. This is a full-time paid internship based at our HQ office in Mountain View, CA.

Responsibilities

  • Utilize data engineering tools to process big data in a scalable and automated fashion
  • Aggregate data from various sources to construct streamlined data pipelines and integrate data from multiple systems
  • Design and build business KPI dashboards and data visualizations
  • Identify key metrics and build exec-facing dashboards to track the progress of the business and its highest priority initiatives
  • Identify key business levers, establish cause & effect, perform analyses, and communicate key findings to various stakeholders to facilitate data-driven decision-making
  • Work closely across the matrix with teams like Marketing, Product, Engineering, and Senior Executives
  • Lead and participate in special projects/initiatives: innovate and implement large-scale quality improvements to processes and/or systems by conducting data analysis and making recommendations, troubleshooting technical issues, and refining processes around customer support

Basic Qualifications

  • Must be earning a Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in Computer Science, Math, Statistics, Data Science, or related field
  • Experience in at least one programming language (eg. R, Python, Hive, Java, Ruby, Scala/Spark or Perl etc)
  • Experience with SQL or other relational databases.
  • Demonstrated experience, familiarity and ease with handling large data sets and crunching numbers
  • Strong written and verbal communication skills with the ability to translate complex problems into simpler terms, and effectively influence both peers and senior leadership

Preferred Qualifications:

  • Experience with data visualization tools (eg. Tableau, BI dashboarding, R visualization packages, etc.)
  • Experience building front-end visualizations using JavaScript frameworks (eg. jQuery, Marionette, D3, or Highcharts).
  • Experience in applied statistics and statistical modeling in at least one statistical software package, (eg. Advanced R package, SAS, SPSS)
  • Experience in Hadoop or other MapReduce paradigms and associated languages such as Pig and Hive

Mass Markets is a rapidly growing, industry leading business process outsourcing and software development organization. POSITION RESPONSIBILITIES:
WHAT DOES AN IT DESKTOP SUPPORT DO?

This position provides basic technical onsite and remote support including diagnosis of user problems related to specific supported hardware, software, and networking services provided by the IT department. Reporting directly to the director of network engineering, this position serves as the first point of contact troubleshooting, technology training, and new technology needs and facilitates the next level of support personnel for issues he/she cannot individually resolve.

Problem recognition, research, isolation, resolution, and follow-up for all computers and software within the organization.
Install and configure new hardware, maintain existing hardware, and track hardware inventory in real-time.
Operating system and software installation and configuration and maintain an accurate software license tracking system in real-time.
Asset management - responsible for tracking desktop hardware and software inventory in real-time.
On-site support - participate in end-user support and problem management for all areas of the IT infrastructure.
Coordinate with supervisors to provide high-quality support for new systems, projects and upgrades.
Other duties as assigned.

CANDIDATE QUALIFICATIONS:
WONDER IF YOU ARE A GOOD FIT?

Qualified candidates will be willing to learn new programs, processes and technology. Candidates should be positive, driven and confident individuals that will represent the company and its customers professionally at all times. Experience in customer care, sales or contact center role is a plus. To perform this job successfully, an individual must be able to perform each essential duty satisfactorily. The requirements listed below are representative of the knowledge, skill, and/or ability required. The primary requirements of this position include but are not limited to the following:

Desktop Support or IT Help Desk experience
Proficiency researching and troubleshooting complex problems and errors
Demonstrated ability with basic networking, and telephony
Demonstrated ability to research, plan, document, and execute complex tasks/projects
Excellent written and oral communication skills
Excellent interpersonal and customer service skills
Excellent work ethic and dedication
Associate’s (or equivalent) degree in Computer Science or Information Technology from a technical school OR equivalent combination of education and experience
CompTIA (A+, Network +, Server+ and Security+ certifications and/or Microsoft Certified IT Professional (MCITP) are a plus but not required

WANT AN EMPLOYER THAT VALUES YOUR CONTRIBUTION?

We believe that hard work should pay off, so we make sure that our compensation and total rewards are competitive. Standard starting compensation is commensurate with experience. Regular reviews and raises are awarded based on tenure and performance, so our employees make more each year.

Employees earn paid time off as well as paid holidays and paid training opportunities. Regular daily, weekly and monthly incentives are part of the overall compensation our team members enjoy and include monetary incentive and prizes such as computers, tablets, phones, TV’s, trips, tickets, and even cars. In addition to our standard group benefits offering for full-time employees following 90-days of employment, all employees are eligible to opt for our MEC medical plan after only 30-days of employment. ROLE

The Junior Web Developer Intern will work closely with our developers, creatives and the broader account team, to build and maintain digital projects for our growing list of clients. In this role, we're looking for someone with a good foundational knowledge of HTML, CSS, and JavaScript, and an intense desire to learn more. We are accepting interns still in school or recent graduates looking for a permanent position. This is a paid internship.

We work in a fast-paced environment where there is always something new to learn, and so much opportunity for growth.

Key Areas of Responsibility:
Work closely with the development team to help build paid media assets for the agencies roster of clients
Maintain existing websites through ongoing updates, optimizations and refreshes

Support in the build of websites and promotional landing pages

Research problems discovered in testing or production with a strong sense of ownership and develop solutions to address the problems
Collaborate with the team to stay abreast of emerging technologies and how they can be applied to projects and clients
Support change and help accelerate innovation

Full Job Description
Company Description

We are seeking the best and brightest 2021 college graduates for our summer internship program. This is a tremendous opportunity to join a world-class marketing team. Approximately 50% of our internships have converted to full-time hires.

Sosemo is an award-winning digital marketing agency that specializes in search marketing, paid social, and media buying. Our internship program lasts approximately 3 months. Interns typically work 4 hours per day, 4 days per week.

During that time, interns rotate across our Paid Search (SEM), SEO, and Paid Social teams. This allows interns to gain a working knowledge of each marketing channel. Accommodations may be made if interns have a preference for a particular channel.

A portion of your time as an intern will be dedicated to training, while the other portion will be spent gaining hands-on experience assisting with campaign management, reporting, and related duties. You may also be required to assist with ad hoc requests such as data entry for new business.

Our internship program pays minimum wage. Consideration will be made to offer a full-time position at the end of 90 days to those who impress. Full-time employees earn a competitive salary, yearly bonus, and benefits.

Our office is located down the street from the New York Stock Exchange at 60 Broad Street. In addition to working with a stellar team, our office has beautiful common areas, weekly yoga/meditation, spectacular views of the Statue of Liberty, and free coffee and beer. Please note: our office is following all CDC guidelines and only allowing 50% capacity at this time. Employees currently have the option to work remotely, though working from our office is encouraged.

You can learn more about Sosemo @ www.sosemo.com.

Learn and follow the “Sosemo Approach”
Research and keep up on industry trends
Assist with managing in-house search marketing and social media campaigns aimed at obtaining new business
In-house social media community management
Assist with Salesforce data entry for new business

Qualifications

4-year college degree in marketing, advertising, management, psychology, computer science, or related field
3.0 GPA or above from an accredited university
Prior exposure to search marketing and/or paid social media marketing
Demonstrated interest in digital marketing
Passion for digital marketing and entrepreneurship
Must have strong analytical and problem solving skills
Must have strong verbal and written communication skills
Ability to manage and prioritize multiple projects simultaneously
Must be able to make decisions in a fast-paced environment
Must be highly detail-orientated

position: Exciting Graphic Design Internship at Sports AI Start-Up Fall 2021
description:
Full Job Description

Sparrow is an early-stage startup that uses artificial intelligence (AI) to help athletes improve.

We are offering a valuable Graphic Design Summer internship for a bright, motivated, resourceful College Student or Recent College Graduate looking to learn the ins and outs of the startup, A.I. tech, sports worlds, and most importantly designing for an innovative and fast paced company.

You’ll work closely with the company’s serial-entrepreneur CEO & Head of Design to strategize and create for our 2021 agenda, which includes:

  • Sparrow's App Store Launch
  • Email Marketing Campaigns (content creation)
  • Social Media Presence (content creation)
  • Brand and Web Presence Development (content creation)
  • Public Relations Updates and Announcements (content creation)
  • Influencer Outreach and Collaboration
  • User feedback communication
  • And much more!

Person sought must:

  • Be a student enrolled at or a recent graduate of a reputable 4-year college, with a Graphic Design or related degree and/or experience.
  • Be able to work an 8 hour work day (-40 hours per week) Spring through end of August 2021 or longer (Flexible starting dates available)
  • Be uber-productive, able to switch between different kinds of tasks, and comfortable taking on all jobs complex or mundane.
  • Be experienced and comfortable using online tools like G Suite, Social Media outlets (Facebook, Youtube, Instagram, and Twitter), and most importantly the Adobe Creative Suite.
  • Be very detail-oriented and thoughtful when executing a task or initiative
  • Be a Team member, open to collaborative work and creative input within a team setting
  • Be able to figure out how things work, or how to get things done when a solution isn’t obvious or involves multiple steps or tools - Innovative Thinker
  • Ideally have experience with video editing and creation (Adobe Premiere Pro, Adobe After Effects)
  • Provide a portfolio or link to portfolio website to show a strong aptitude towards creative effective and innovative designs
  • Have strong Typography and Graphic Design principals (Hierarchy, Color Theory, Design Trends, Design Thinking)

This position represents a unique opportunity to:

  • Work closely with the company founders, successful serial entrepreneurs who have started numerous companies, raised over $20 million in venture capital for them, and have 2 successful exits. (check out our founders here: https://youtu.be/r82gufgzltg)
  • Learn the ins-and-outs of running a startup with tremendous potential that is just getting started
  • Have your work showcased throughout many platforms and within multiple facets of a company
  • Work somewhere you can grow as both a designer and in your professional practice
  • Work in an environment that will allow your designs and creative input to be seen, recognized, and grow with our great startup
  • Receive a $50 weekly stipend, college credit and potentially earn an equity bonus (stock options), and more importantly gain relationships in the Design, Tech, AI, and Sports Industry

Testimonials from Sparrow’s Intern Classes

*At Sparrow I assisted with fundraising rounds, analyzing consumer/user data & conceptualizing macro marketing schemes - experiences that will help me for years to come. - Nick S., USC (Business Major)

* I loved getting exposure into the fast paced start-up world - my internship with Sparrow was awesome!

- Rebecca R., Brown University (Women’s Varsity Soccer, Applied Math major)

* Interning at Sparrow was so valuable! I got to work with the founders and see first hand how a successful company is made! - Annie M, Lehigh (Womens’ Varsity Lacrosse, Business Major)

* My internship with Sparrow was great! I worked on an investment and PR project that contributed to the launch of the company. - Colette M., Columbia University (Women's Varsity Soccer)

position: Data Science Professional Development Program (PDP) Internship - Summer 2022
description:
Full Job Description
We are an equal opportunity employer and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, age, citizenship, color, religion, sex, marital status, national origin, disability status, gender identity or expression, protected veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law.

Description

At BASF, we create chemistry through the power of connected minds. By balancing economic success with environmental protection and social responsibility, we are building a more sustainable future through chemistry. As the world’s leading chemical company, we help our customers in nearly every industry meet the current and future needs of society through science and innovation.

We provide a challenging and rewarding work environment with a strong emphasis on process safety, as well as the safety of our employees and the communities we operate in and are always working to form the best team—especially from within, through an emphasis on lifelong learning and development.

We are constantly striving to become an even better place to work. BASF has been recognized by Forbes Magazine as one of America's Best Large Employers in 2021 and for the ninth consecutive year, BASF was named one of the Top 50 Companies for Diversity by DiversityInc, moving up two places from 14 in 2020 to 12 in 2021. BASF was also recognized as a Top Company for Environmental, Social & Governance (ESG) for its corporate social responsibility and philanthropic programs, practices and investments. Come join us on our journey to create solutions for a sustainable future!

Professional Development Program (PDP) Internship – Data Science Summer 2022

BASF's Data Science Summer Internship is created to provide highly motivated, mobile-minded current university students an opportunity to enhance their professional skills through a variety of diverse learning experiences. Participants will contribute to leading-edge data science projects and will be guided to apply data science skills in a real-world setting.

Where the Chemistry Happens…

You start as an intern in a leading-edge team with expertise in Data Science, Statistics, and Operations Research - Advanced Business Analytics (ABA). Advanced Business Analytics co-creates and delivers innovative data-driven solutions for better business decisions through mathematical modeling. These solutions are developed and delivered in collaboration with all business and functional units (including Procurement, Production, Supply Chain, Planning & Controlling, Marketing & Sales, and Finance).

Responsible for leveraging mathematics to propel paradigm shifts across the entire company, the Intern will support the initiation, execution, and completion of projects in the areas of Data Science, Artificial Intelligence, and Optimization to increase business profitability and reduce costs.

The Intern will be ‘hands-on’ and work on projects to execute deliverables during all phases of an analytics project, starting from project definition to completion. Deliverables will include the development of the appropriate mathematical models, collaborating with members from other functions to gather and validate the necessary data, and presenting the project results and benefits to key stake holders and internal clients. Also, communicating the ideas and solutions of advanced business analytics to a broad community of non-mathematicians and acting as a driving force in international and interdisciplinary project teams will be a key success-factor.

Program Summary:
As a highly motivated undergraduate student, you will participate in a summer internship program at one of BASF’s North American sites
Utilizing your experience in your area of study, you will help complete various data science projects which will provide the opportunity to further develop both technical and professional skills

Create Your Own Chemistry: What We Offer You…

We offer students the opportunity to spend a summer working at a North American BASF site within the U.S. to apply their education and background to challenging assignments that build both technical and professional skills. Our PDP internship is a precursor to our rotational programs, which combine hands-on experience with unparalleled networking and development opportunities designed to accelerate your career at BASF.

Enhanced career development and the opportunity to explore possible career tracks within the company
Development of your expertise and the ability to network at senior levels throughout BASF and establish mentoring relationships that could span across your whole career
The opportunity for consideration of future opportunities within the organization including the Full-time Data Science Professional Development Program

To learn more about our programs, please visit www.basf.com/universitycareers.

Qualifications - BASF recognizes institutions of Higher Education which are accredited by the Council for Higher Education Accreditation or equivalent

Formula for Success:
Undergraduate students majoring in Applied Mathematics, Computer Science, Computer Engineering, Data Science, Software Engineering, Statistics, Chemical Engineering, or related field
Authorization to work in the U.S. now and in the future without restrictions or need for future sponsorship
College Juniors preferred (May 2023 - July 2023 grads)
Demonstrated academic achievement (Minimum GPA 3.2)
Commitment to relocate anywhere in the U.S.
Programming experience in R and Python, other languages a plus
Strong analytical skills
Fast learner
Motivated to learn about machine learning, artificial intelligence, big data, and new technologies
Active participation in extracurricular activities and on-campus organizations
Previous internship/co-op experience is a plus

Full Job Description
The Software / Embedded Systems Engineer Intern will develop software and firmware for Ayar Labs’ electronic-photonic chips, perform initial chip bringup of custom systems-on-chip (SoC) platforms and assist other engineers during the software and firmware development cycle. As part of these roles, you will be expected to work with microcontrollers, FPGAs, and various board-level hardware/software to achieve the desired system functionality. You will be joining a small team in a dynamic startup environment, where each member is expected to take on a wide range of responsibilities and to learn and grow with the company.

Essential Functions:
Development and optimize firmware/software used for controlling the hardware components of complex electronic-photonic chips with multiple high-speed SerDes
Perform chip bring-up and initial functional test of new custom silicon
Work closely with both integrated circuit designers and optical designers to understand chip features and operating modes
Work closely with test engineers to hand off chip testing platform after initial silicon bringup
Work closely with firmware/software engineers on various programming tasks

Basic Qualifications:
Pursuing a degree in Electrical Engineering, Computer Engineering, Computer Science, or hsa equivalent skills and/or experience
Illustrates a strong programming background, with developing in both low-level programming languages (C/C++) as well as Python
Understanding of basic circuit theory and electronics at a system level
Proficiency with version control software, such as Git
Self-driven debugger who loves digging deeper to determine a root cause

Preferred Qualifications:
Experience in silicon bring-up and firmware development for high-speed SerDes
Experience with high speed digital communications silicon/system products.
Experience working with and interfacing with microcontrollers and/or FPGAs through serial communication
Experience prototyping or designing PCB-level hardware, including schematic design, component selection, chip interface management (SPI, I2C, etc.), and PCB layout

Principals only. Recruiters, payment for recruiting activities is only applicable subject to a signed and executed agreement between the parties. Please don’t contact our hiring managers.

About Ayar Labs

At Ayar Labs we are about to revolutionize computing by moving data with light. We’re unleashing processing power for artificial intelligence, high performance computing, and telecommunications by removing the bottlenecks created by today’s electrical I/O - making it possible to continue scaling computing system performance. Ayar Labs is the first to deliver in-package optical I/O chiplets, a new universal I/O solution that replaces traditional electrical I/O and enables chips to communicate with each other from millimeters to kilometers, to deliver orders of magnitude improvements in latency, bandwidth density, and power consumption.

With our strong collaborations with industry leaders and government, our deep ties to MIT and UC Berkeley, and our commitment to hiring the best engineers in photonics and electronics, joining our team gives you the opportunity to collaborate with renowned experts on challenging, paradigm-shifting work.

We are passionate about delivering in-package optical I/O at scale, leveraging the strength of our patent portfolio and our team of leading interdisciplinary experts. We believe that deep cross-collaboration between teams facilitated by honest, open debate is the best way to drive innovation and achieve big wins. Join our team and experience the possibilities.

Job #1-Network Operations Engineer
**NO C2C or Visas-Full-Time/Perm Job. **NO Interns/Trainees Please.

Client Profile:
Our XXX company fuels the Global Capital Markets community through the provision of trading technology and analytics solutions. As financial industry experts at the center of markets and technology, we help our clients efficiently scale their business and quickly access markets, supporting them through the full trading lifecycle. We are a Global Company headquartered in New York, with nine offices across the globe.

Purpose of the Role:
The Network Operations Team is responsible for maintaining the operational stability of all aspects of the Client's XXX proprietary electronic trading network, The Client XXX is a cutting edge, multi-vendor, multi-technology network that spans over forty locations globally.

Network Operations provide critical front-line support across many of the Client's XXX infrastructure technology domains, including, but not limited to:

Global and Regional WAN connectivity.
Metro Area Dark Fibre networks.
Ultra Low Latency Trading Fabric.
Edge connectivity to 200+ Financial Markets.
Data Center LAN networks in 40+ locations.
Market Data Feeds.
Bespoke client Trading environments.

Network Operations are a Global Team consisting of regional teams located in London, New York, Singapore, and Tokyo. The team operates a follow-the-sun model that provides dedicated network support 24 hours a day, 365 days a year.

This is a client facing role that demands a high standard of customer service and technical support be provided to both our internal and external clients.
Alongside normal daily activities, the role provides the opportunity to participate in project-based initiatives and collaboration with other technology teams.

Responsibilities and duties (include but are not limited to):
  • Diagnose the root cause of operational issues and provide suitable technical solutions for effective resolution.
  • Perform triage, troubleshooting, and fault resolution as part of Client's XXX Incident Management process.
  • Monitor the operational health of the network infrastructure using Event Management Systems and analysis tools.
  • Prepare and implement network changes in accordance with Client's XXX Change Management policy.
  • Work directly with clients to assist with support queries in alignment with Service Level Agreements, SLAs.
  • Identify opportunities within the environment to reduce inefficiencies, increase
operational stability, and enhance security.
  • Create and maintain technical documentation, including: infrastructure diagrams,
procedural run books, and knowledge base pages.
  • Adopt the use of the DevOps tool set to efficiently complete discovery and implementation tasks.
  • Manage client and internal case queues for all incident and project-based work.
  • Participate in Global Team collaboration efforts, including: shift handover, technical peer reviews, and knowledge transfers.
Education, Skills, and Background (including experience requirements):
  • 3 – 5 years of experience working in a large Enterprise or Service Provider environment.
  • Certified to CCNP level, or equivalent level of knowledge and experience.
  • Clear written and verbal communication skills.
  • Ability to prioritize and manage own workload.
  • Experience working within the Financial Industry Highly Preferred.
Required Skills:
  • Solid understanding of IPv4 addressing with the ability to subnet using VLSM.
  • Demonstrable understanding and experience supporting the following: o 802.1q VLANs and Trunks.
Multiple Spanning Tree Protocol.
o Etherchannel o Static Routing .
o OSPFv2 o BGPv4
o Routing protocol redistribution o Network Traffic Engineering using routing policies o Access Control Lists o Network Address Translation.
  • Good understanding of the TCP/IP stack and TCP/UDP operation.
  • Ability to diagnose the root cause of networking issues within complex network environments.
  • Ability to create and analyze packet captures to identify network and application issues.
  • Experience supporting Enterprise Firewall Platforms.
  • Experience configuring and troubleshooting IPSec VPNs.
  • Experience working with Network Management Systems utilizing SNMP & Syslog.
Preferred Skills:
  • Demonstrable understanding and experience supporting PIM Sparse Mode Multicast, Source Specific Multicast, and IGMPv2/v3.
  • Demonstrable understanding and experience supporting Network Time protocols – PTP, NTP, PPS.
  • Experience supporting the following platforms: Arista, Cisco Nexus, Cisco ASA, Fortigate, Palo Alto, Corvil.
  • Experience using Automation Technologies: Python, Ansible, Git.
Working Arrangements:
The working days for this role are Monday to Friday. The role holder will be expected to participate in a monthly shift rotation that consists of working a full-shift on one Saturday and on-call cover for the immediately following Sunday.
This is an office-based position, but occasional travel may be required by the business as part of this role.

Full Job Description
Provide support to Savannah River Remediation (SRR) as a Student Intern - Limited Service Employee (LSE) in the Training Technologies group on the Savannah River Site (SRS), a US Department of Energy (DOE) facility in western South Carolina.

The SRR Training Technologies group is implementing 3-D technology using a 3-D laser scanner and various software to make training more compelling. This Capstone project allows students an opportunity to provide Virtual Reality, Augmented Reality, and Mixed Reality (VR/AR/MR) programming/development capability and experience to the Liquid Waste organization with emphasis on augmented reality (AR) using a device called zSpace® and the gaming engine Unity3D. Students will learn how to model 3-D objects with computer aided design (CAD) software, as well as program backend logic to create an interactive experience for users.

The selected intern will perform meaningful work in support of the organization. Guidance will be provided using SRR processes and procedures. Interns will prepare and present a final project to the SRR management team summarizing conclusions about the experience, impacts delivered and relevance for their future career.

Additional Information
The internship will take place during the second semester (Fall 2021) for a USCA Student. Housing is not provided but reasonable rentals may be available through the University of South Carolina-Aiken student housing office.

Interns will be paid a competitive hourly rate; no part-time interns will be assigned to shift work; overtime is not available; Interns will be paid for site holidays as applicable.

Assignments will be located in SRR facilities on the 300sq mile DOE site outside of Aiken, SC. Public transportation is not available and interns will be required to arrange their own transportation. A valid Driver’s License, Registration and proof of automobile insurance is required for driving on the Savannah River Site.

If you are selected to participate in the SRR internship program, additional information will be requested such as: SRR employment application, references and official transcripts. You will be assigned to SRS General Employee Training and Drug and Alcohol test appointments before badging and commencement of assignment.

Please visit www.srremediation.com for more information about Savannah River Remediation's mission and values.

Minimum Qualifications

Candidate must be enrolled as a full-time student at an accredited four year university, and currently working towards a Bachelor’s Degree in Mathematics or Computer Science.
Must have a cumulative GPA of 2.5 or above and completed their sophomore year.

In addition:
Two items will be scheduled before the intern starts work at Savannah River Site.
Must pass General Employment Training (GET)
Must pass Drug and Alcohol Testing (DAT)

Preferred Qualifications

Student should have basic knowledge of C# and game development.
Preference will be given to University of South Carolina-Aiken Capstone students participating in this program

About us

Savannah River Remediation LLC, a prime contractor for the US Department of Energy, is responsible for managing the Department of Energy’s Savannah River Site’s Liquid Waste operations contract. Located in Aiken, South Carolina, SRR is a limited liability company formed by nuclear operations and environmental remediation global leaders Amentum Bechtel, BWXT, and Jacobs. The SRR Team is responsible for the closure of waste tanks, the operation of the Savannah River Site’s Defense Waste Processing Facility, tank farm operations and associated production and disposal facilities. www.srremediation.com

position: Frame Design Rule Checking - Fall 2021 Intern
description:
Full Job Description
About GLOBALFOUNDRIES:
GLOBALFOUNDRIES is a leading full-service semiconductor foundry providing a unique combination of design, development, and fabrication services to some of the world’s most inspired technology companies. With a global manufacturing footprint spanning three continents, GLOBALFOUNDRIES makes possible the technologies and systems that transform industries and give customers the power to shape their markets. GLOBALFOUNDRIES is owned by Mubadala Investment Company. For more information, visit www.globalfoundries.com .

Summary of Role :
GLOBALFOUNDRIES Fab 8/9/10 Frame Team, which is part of the Tapeout organization, is seeking a talented and motivated person to join the team who is pursuing semiconductor product, design automation or software development skills.

The Tapeout organization is responsible for the successful delivery of photomasks to our wafer fabs. The delivery of photomasks involves several design and computational processes, one of which is the wafer inline process monitoring content (PCM) included in a physical structure known as the Frame which borders our customers designs. Designing of the Frame involves optical, electrical and physical structures that are translated onto each photomask level in parallel with the customers design and mask manufacturing content.

You will primarily be responsible for learning how Frames spanning several different technology nodes incorporate additional content via automation to meet manufacturability criteria and then interpret as well as translate layout design rules into a Mentor Graphics Calibre svrf scripted Frame Design Rule Checking (DRC) tool. Additionally, you may develop documentation as required associated with the DRC enablement. The technologies nodes may include Bulk, SOI, RF CMOS or other differentiated offerings. You will be a member of the broader Global Tapeout Operations team that produces masks encompassing both the Frame and product chip designs. Other tasks may include writing programs using scripting languages to continuously improve the efficiency of generating Frames in a quality manner. A person in this role will have the opportunity to interact with Frame Engineers, Design Manual Owners, Design Rule Engineers, and Design Enablement as well as Process Design Kit (PDK) Engineers. The person in this role must be able to work effectively in a remote learning and work setting as your immediate Manager and your primary Mentor may reside at a different site than you will be located. This position is planned to be located at the GLOBALFOUNDRIES site in Austin, Texas.

The intern will have the opportunity to learn about a semiconductor Foundry’s Frame verification approach as well as at least one Design Rule Checking (DRC) methodology while gaining exposure to industry offered Electronic Design Automation (EDA) tools.

Essential Responsibilities:
Learn how Frames spanning several different technology nodes incorporate additional content via automation
Interpret and translate layout design rules into a Mentor Graphics Calibre svrf scripted Design Rule Checking (DRC) deck
Develop documentation as required associated with the DRC enablement
Write programs using scripting languages to continuously improve the efficiency of generating Frames
Interact with interact with Frame Engineers, Design Manual Owners, Design Rule Engineers, and Design Enablement as well as Process Design Kit (PDK) Engineers
Work effectively in a remote learning and work setting

Other Responsibilities:
Perform all activities in a safe and responsible manner and support all Environmental, Health, Safety & Security requirements and programs

Required Qualifications:
Enrolled in a BS/MS in Electrical Engineering, Software Engineering, Computer Engineering or Computer Science degree
Experience with Python or Shell Scripting
Experience using Cadence Virtuoso or an equivalent design layout tool
Experience using a Design Rule Checking (DRC) tool, such as Mentor Graphics Calibre
Fluency in English Language – written & verbal
Travel: 0-to-10% Travel required

Preferred Qualifications:
Experience coding a Design Rule Checking (DRC) tool, specifically Mentor Graphics Calibre svrf
Experience using Cadence Quickview or an equivalent design viewing tool
Experience using office productivity software tools (preferably Microsoft products)
Prior experience as an intern in the Semiconductor industry in a related role, such as PDK development or Tapeout with knowledge in related areas such as mask data preparation, inline metrology, reticle construction, testchips, reticle frame building, OPC or mask manufacturing
Familiar with Software Engineering with Programming Languages (Java, Perl) or scripting language (Korn Shell) on a Linux platform or relational database experience
Familiar with programming (React, JSP, Spring Framework, JavaScript/Dojo, LDAP, AJAX, Rest Services, JBoss, CSS and LSF)

If you need a reasonable accommodation for any part of the employment process, please contact us by email at usaccommodations@globalfoundries.com and let us know the nature of your request and your contact information. Requests for accommodation will be considered on a case-by-case basis. Please note that only inquiries concerning a request for reasonable accommodation will be responded to from this email address.

An offer of employment with GLOBALFOUNDRIES is conditioned upon the successful completion of a background check and drug screen, as applicable and subject to applicable laws and regulations.

GLOBALFOUNDRIES is fully committed to equal opportunity in the workplace and believes that cultural diversity within the company enhances its business potential. GLOBALFOUNDRIES goal of excellence in business necessitates the attraction and retention of highly qualified people. Artificial barriers and stereotypic biases detract from this objective and may be illegally discriminatory.

Full Job Description
The team that powers electronic trading

The Statistical Modeling and Development team as part of Barclays’ Front Office trading, creates eTrading (agency and internal algorithms) models, machine learning models, undertakes other data science and software development projects. The team partners with Sales & Trading, Technology, Risk and other control functions to deliver industry-leading algorithms for automated pricing, risk management and execution across all asset classes. Join us as an intern and discover where technical discipline and business intersect.

What to expect

As an Electronic Trading intern, you’ll take your first steps in the extremely challenging and fascinating world of algorithmic trading & data science. Working with a broad spectrum of colleagues, you’ll learn how data science fits into our business. What’s more, you’ll help our team to turn mathematical and algorithmic ideas into trading reality.

Our program runs in two streams – Research and Engineering. This allows us to align you with problems tailored to your skill sets and interests. In the Research stream, you will spend time modeling research, prototyping your theory and testing how it can function in various scenarios. The Engineering stream will allow you to code and learn how theory is converted into practice. Your pieces of code could even be delivered into a production style environment.

In this intensely computing-based role, you could get involved in:

learning to use statistical models and algorithmic coding in practice
test practical machine learning techniques
researching and implementing new models
expanding our computational platform by helping solve complex software development problems.

How you’ll develop

Throughout the summer, our support will help you deliver your best work. In our team-driven environment, you’ll find that mentoring happens naturally and friendships are easy to form. Mentors will guide your progress, and networking and social events will provide a fully rounded experience.

As part of your summer experience, you’ll receive performance feedback. By the time the summer’s over, you’ll walk away with a solid understanding of eTrading business, our culture and your potential place within it. We invite top-performing, eligible summer associates to join us full-time after graduation.

To be considered for this program, you must:
be working towards a PhD or Master’s in a technical discipline such as statistics, computer science, mathematics, physics, quantitative finance, operations research or similar
be on track to complete your degree between December 2022 – June 2023.

Who thrives here:
people with strong logical thinking, problem solving, mathematical aptitude
people with exceptional computational thinking and strong programming skills in JAVA/C++, R, Python or similar programming languages
communication skills and a teamwork mentality are key in this role.

Ready to apply?

Please submit an application to Barclays’ online system. Then, submit your resume and cover letter through your school’s career management application system if required. Please note that you can apply to only one Barclays’ internship program globally.

About Barclays

Barclays is a British universal bank. We are diversified by business, by different types of customers and clients, and by geography. Our businesses include consumer banking and payments operations around the world, as well as a top-tier, full service, global corporate and investment bank, all of which are supported by our service company which provides technology, operations and functional services across the firm.

We are an equal opportunity employer and we are opposed to discrimination on any grounds.

Dynamic working gives everyone at Barclays the opportunity to integrate professional and personal lives, if you have a need for flexibility then please discuss this with the hiring manager.

Our Purpose and Values

We deploy finance responsibly to support people and businesses, acting with empathy and integrity, championing innovation and sustainability for the common good and the long term.

Our values underpin everything we do: Respect, Integrity, Service, Excellence and Stewardship.

Respect

We harness the power of diversity and inclusion in our business, trust those we work with, and value everyone's contribution.

For further information about Barclays, please visit our website home.barclays

To learn more about careers at Barclays, visit search.jobs.barclays

It is the policy of Barclays to ensure equal employment opportunity without discrimination or harassment on the basis of race, color, creed, religion, national origin, alienage or citizenship status, age, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, marital or domestic/civil partnership status, disability, protected veteran status, genetic information, or any other basis protected by law.

position: Data Science Professional Development Program (PDP) Internship - Summer 2022
description:
Full Job Description
We are an equal opportunity employer and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, age, citizenship, color, religion, sex, marital status, national origin, disability status, gender identity or expression, protected veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law.

Description

At BASF, we create chemistry through the power of connected minds. By balancing economic success with environmental protection and social responsibility, we are building a more sustainable future through chemistry. As the world’s leading chemical company, we help our customers in nearly every industry meet the current and future needs of society through science and innovation.

We provide a challenging and rewarding work environment with a strong emphasis on process safety, as well as the safety of our employees and the communities we operate in and are always working to form the best team—especially from within, through an emphasis on lifelong learning and development.

We are constantly striving to become an even better place to work. BASF has been recognized by Forbes Magazine as one of America's Best Large Employers in 2021 and for the ninth consecutive year, BASF was named one of the Top 50 Companies for Diversity by DiversityInc, moving up two places from 14 in 2020 to 12 in 2021. BASF was also recognized as a Top Company for Environmental, Social & Governance (ESG) for its corporate social responsibility and philanthropic programs, practices and investments. Come join us on our journey to create solutions for a sustainable future!

Professional Development Program (PDP) Internship – Data Science Summer 2022

BASF's Data Science Summer Internship is created to provide highly motivated, mobile-minded current university students an opportunity to enhance their professional skills through a variety of diverse learning experiences. Participants will contribute to leading-edge data science projects and will be guided to apply data science skills in a real-world setting.

Where the Chemistry Happens…

You start as an intern in a leading-edge team with expertise in Data Science, Statistics, and Operations Research - Advanced Business Analytics (ABA). Advanced Business Analytics co-creates and delivers innovative data-driven solutions for better business decisions through mathematical modeling. These solutions are developed and delivered in collaboration with all business and functional units (including Procurement, Production, Supply Chain, Planning & Controlling, Marketing & Sales, and Finance).

Responsible for leveraging mathematics to propel paradigm shifts across the entire company, the Intern will support the initiation, execution, and completion of projects in the areas of Data Science, Artificial Intelligence, and Optimization to increase business profitability and reduce costs.

The Intern will be ‘hands-on’ and work on projects to execute deliverables during all phases of an analytics project, starting from project definition to completion. Deliverables will include the development of the appropriate mathematical models, collaborating with members from other functions to gather and validate the necessary data, and presenting the project results and benefits to key stake holders and internal clients. Also, communicating the ideas and solutions of advanced business analytics to a broad community of non-mathematicians and acting as a driving force in international and interdisciplinary project teams will be a key success-factor.

Program Summary:
As a highly motivated undergraduate student, you will participate in a summer internship program at one of BASF’s North American sites
Utilizing your experience in your area of study, you will help complete various data science projects which will provide the opportunity to further develop both technical and professional skills

Create Your Own Chemistry: What We Offer You…

We offer students the opportunity to spend a summer working at a North American BASF site within the U.S. to apply their education and background to challenging assignments that build both technical and professional skills. Our PDP internship is a precursor to our rotational programs, which combine hands-on experience with unparalleled networking and development opportunities designed to accelerate your career at BASF.

Enhanced career development and the opportunity to explore possible career tracks within the company
Development of your expertise and the ability to network at senior levels throughout BASF and establish mentoring relationships that could span across your whole career
The opportunity for consideration of future opportunities within the organization including the Full-time Data Science Professional Development Program

To learn more about our programs, please visit www.basf.com/universitycareers.

Qualifications - BASF recognizes institutions of Higher Education which are accredited by the Council for Higher Education Accreditation or equivalent

Undergraduate students majoring in Applied Mathematics, Computer Science, Computer Engineering, Data Science, Software Engineering, Statistics, Chemical Engineering, or related field
Authorization to work in the U.S. now and in the future without restrictions or need for future sponsorship
College Juniors preferred (May 2023 - July 2023 grads)
Demonstrated academic achievement (Minimum GPA 3.2)
Commitment to relocate anywhere in the U.S.
Programming experience in R and Python, other languages a plus
Strong analytical skills
Fast learner
Motivated to learn about machine learning, artificial intelligence, big data, and new technologies
Active participation in extracurricular activities and on-campus organizations
Previous internship/co-op experience is a plus

Full Job Description
DataPath's MaxView Enterprise Network Management System is a powerful solution that enables our customers to see the state of their entire network, control multi-vendor devices, automate complex service tasks, and unify disparate systems into one view.

We are looking for qualified, computer science/engineering intern candidates to join our software teams in support of the development and integration of our MaxView software. A typical Software Intern will rotate through our software teams to get exposure to multiple tools, languages, and frameworks, (including Java, Hibernate, HTML5, CSS3, Javascript, OSGI/Knopflerfish, AngularJS, JQuery, Python, Spring, Distributed Services Architecture (DSA) and DSLink, Maven, Eclipse, Netbeans, Tomcat/TomEE and more). Don't worry - you'll learn them as you go.

Our goal is to find candidates and share in the mutual benefits of growing interns into well-trained, well-prepared engineers. Must be available for a full-time intern position. Not conducive to taking courses simultaneously during the intern position.

  • Work alongside our software team to assist with internal and external development and integration projects.
  • Create script-based drivers to interface MaxView with customer hardware.
  • Create UI web pages.
  • Assist with programming tasks directly on the MaxView product.
  • Execute software testing to validate core product enhancements.
The most successful interns will have a strong passion for software development, be critical thinkers, and possess a desire to learn in a fast-paced, team environment. Some experience with software development is required. The position does not include relocation.

Minimum Requirements

  • Self-starter willing to take on projects with minimal guidance.
  • Possess an outgoing personality and a team-first attitude.

You’ll be empowered to build community, explore your passions and achieve your goals. This is your chance to bring your solutions and ideas to life while working on cutting-edge technology. The internship is designed not only for you to do great work with the opportunity to learn and grow, but to experience our culture full of diverse community connection, executive engagement, and memorable events.

We’re a company of learn-it-alls rather than know-it-alls and our culture is centered around embracing a growth mindset, a theme of inspiring excellence, and encouraging teams and leaders to bring their best each day. Does this sound like you? Learn more about our cultural attributes.

Job #1-Network Operations Engineer
**NO C2C or Visas-Full-Time/Perm Job. **NO Interns/Trainees Please.

Client Profile:
Our XXX company fuels the Global Capital Markets community through the provision of trading technology and analytics solutions. As financial industry experts at the center of markets and technology, we help our clients efficiently scale their business and quickly access markets, supporting them through the full trading lifecycle. We are a Global Company headquartered in New York, with nine offices across the globe.

Purpose of the Role:
The Network Operations Team is responsible for maintaining the operational stability of all aspects of the Client's XXX proprietary electronic trading network, The Client XXX is a cutting edge, multi-vendor, multi-technology network that spans over forty locations globally.

Network Operations provide critical front-line support across many of the Client's XXX infrastructure technology domains, including, but not limited to:

Global and Regional WAN connectivity.
Metro Area Dark Fibre networks.
Ultra Low Latency Trading Fabric.
Edge connectivity to 200+ Financial Markets.
Data Center LAN networks in 40+ locations.
Market Data Feeds.
Bespoke client Trading environments.

Network Operations are a Global Team consisting of regional teams located in London, New York, Singapore, and Tokyo. The team operates a follow-the-sun model that provides dedicated network support 24 hours a day, 365 days a year.

This is a client facing role that demands a high standard of customer service and technical support be provided to both our internal and external clients.
Alongside normal daily activities, the role provides the opportunity to participate in project-based initiatives and collaboration with other technology teams.

Responsibilities and duties (include but are not limited to):
  • Diagnose the root cause of operational issues and provide suitable technical solutions for effective resolution.
  • Perform triage, troubleshooting, and fault resolution as part of Client's XXX Incident Management process.
  • Monitor the operational health of the network infrastructure using Event Management Systems and analysis tools.
  • Prepare and implement network changes in accordance with Client's XXX Change Management policy.
  • Work directly with clients to assist with support queries in alignment with Service Level Agreements, SLAs.
  • Identify opportunities within the environment to reduce inefficiencies, increase
operational stability, and enhance security.
  • Create and maintain technical documentation, including: infrastructure diagrams,
procedural run books, and knowledge base pages.
  • Adopt the use of the DevOps tool set to efficiently complete discovery and implementation tasks.
  • Manage client and internal case queues for all incident and project-based work.
  • Participate in Global Team collaboration efforts, including: shift handover, technical peer reviews, and knowledge transfers.
Education, Skills, and Background (including experience requirements):
  • 3 – 5 years of experience working in a large Enterprise or Service Provider environment.
  • Certified to CCNP level, or equivalent level of knowledge and experience.
  • Clear written and verbal communication skills.
  • Ability to prioritize and manage own workload.
  • Experience working within the Financial Industry Highly Preferred.
Required Skills:
  • Solid understanding of IPv4 addressing with the ability to subnet using VLSM.
  • Demonstrable understanding and experience supporting the following: o 802.1q VLANs and Trunks.
Multiple Spanning Tree Protocol.
o Etherchannel o Static Routing .
o OSPFv2 o BGPv4
o Routing protocol redistribution o Network Traffic Engineering using routing policies o Access Control Lists o Network Address Translation.
  • Good understanding of the TCP/IP stack and TCP/UDP operation.
  • Ability to diagnose the root cause of networking issues within complex network environments.
  • Ability to create and analyze packet captures to identify network and application issues.
  • Experience supporting Enterprise Firewall Platforms.
  • Experience configuring and troubleshooting IPSec VPNs.
  • Experience working with Network Management Systems utilizing SNMP & Syslog.
Preferred Skills:
  • Demonstrable understanding and experience supporting PIM Sparse Mode Multicast, Source Specific Multicast, and IGMPv2/v3.
  • Demonstrable understanding and experience supporting Network Time protocols – PTP, NTP, PPS.
  • Experience supporting the following platforms: Arista, Cisco Nexus, Cisco ASA, Fortigate, Palo Alto, Corvil.
  • Experience using Automation Technologies: Python, Ansible, Git.
Working Arrangements:
The working days for this role are Monday to Friday. The role holder will be expected to participate in a monthly shift rotation that consists of working a full-shift on one Saturday and on-call cover for the immediately following Sunday.
This is an office-based position, but occasional travel may be required by the business as part of this role.

Full Job Description
Indy Acoustic Research is seeking a summer engineering intern to assist with
development of tools and apparatus and perform acoustic measurements for a small
business specializing in Engineering Acoustic Design. This position requires a general
knowledge of science and engineering processes, product development, and acute
knowledge in an engineering discipline such as mechanical design, electrical design,
computer science, physics or acoustics. Must be self-starter who can work in a small,
dynamic group environment and has attention to detail. Should have a desire to design
and build objects using Mechanical or Electrical CAD software, 3D printing, and
assembly using hand tools. May conduct or setup acoustic measurements in Anechoic
chamber, Diffuse Sound booth, or Recording Studio and summarize results using
spreadsheets. Knowledge of Physical Acoustics or DAW/Recording software a plus.
Example Duties Actual duties may vary based upon expertise of intern. May include:
  • Design Mechanical CAD of test fixtures using Autodesk Fusion 360
  • Operate and post-process prints from FDM and/or SLA 3D printers
  • Assembly of components such as plastic or metal enclosures, circuit boards and
transducers using mechanical fasteners or adhesives.
  • Run acoustic test scripts on microphones and/or speakers to obtain frequency
response, polar pattern, distortion and other metrics.
  • Set up and calibrate test equipment following verbal instructions and/or written
procedures
  • Write VBA scripts to automatically process or manipulate excel data.
Required
Qualifications
  • Must be 18 years of age
  • Must be able to speak and write fluent English
  • Proficient in Microsoft Office (Word, PowerPoint, Outlook and Excel)
  • Self-Directed and able to work and innovate without supervision, including selftaught learning of new software and hardware.
  • Second-year University level completion of Physics, Calculus, and specialized
engineering courses.
  • General knowledge of in-air Acoustics and Acoustic measures such as: Hertz, dB(SPL),
frequency weighting, averaging, and wave propagation theory
Desired
Qualifications
  • Experience with 3D printing and fabrication
  • Experience with sound recording software such as Digital Audio Workstations
(DAW’s, e.g. Audacity, Audition or Reaper), Room EQ Wizard, or Listen SoundCheck
  • Mechanical design experience using 3D CAD software
  • Familiarity with Raspberry Pi platform, and Linux shell
  • Ability to code in Matlab, Visual Basic/VBA, LabView or Python
  • Ability to solder
