#21-00377-Service Desk Team Lead & a Network Operations Engineer-Full Time-No C2C or Visas-No Interns/Trainees Please.

Job #1-Network Operations Engineer
**NO C2C or Visas-Full-Time/Perm Job. **NO Interns/Trainees Please.

Client Profile:
Our XXX company fuels the Global Capital Markets community through the provision of trading technology and analytics solutions. As financial industry experts at the center of markets and technology, we help our clients efficiently scale their business and quickly access markets, supporting them through the full trading lifecycle. We are a Global Company headquartered in New York, with nine offices across the globe.

Purpose of the Role:
The Network Operations Team is responsible for maintaining the operational stability of all aspects of the Client's XXX proprietary electronic trading network, The Client XXX is a cutting edge, multi-vendor, multi-technology network that spans over forty locations globally.

Network Operations provide critical front-line support across many of the Client's XXX infrastructure technology domains, including, but not limited to:

Global and Regional WAN connectivity.
Metro Area Dark Fibre networks.
Ultra Low Latency Trading Fabric.
Edge connectivity to 200+ Financial Markets.
Data Center LAN networks in 40+ locations.
Market Data Feeds.
Bespoke client Trading environments.

Network Operations are a Global Team consisting of regional teams located in London, New York, Singapore, and Tokyo. The team operates a follow-the-sun model that provides dedicated network support 24 hours a day, 365 days a year.

This is a client facing role that demands a high standard of customer service and technical support be provided to both our internal and external clients.
Alongside normal daily activities, the role provides the opportunity to participate in project-based initiatives and collaboration with other technology teams.

Responsibilities and duties (include but are not limited to):
  • Diagnose the root cause of operational issues and provide suitable technical solutions for effective resolution.
  • Perform triage, troubleshooting, and fault resolution as part of Client's XXX Incident Management process.
  • Monitor the operational health of the network infrastructure using Event Management Systems and analysis tools.
  • Prepare and implement network changes in accordance with Client's XXX Change Management policy.
  • Work directly with clients to assist with support queries in alignment with Service Level Agreements, SLAs.
  • Identify opportunities within the environment to reduce inefficiencies, increase
operational stability, and enhance security.
  • Create and maintain technical documentation, including: infrastructure diagrams,
procedural run books, and knowledge base pages.
  • Adopt the use of the DevOps tool set to efficiently complete discovery and implementation tasks.
  • Manage client and internal case queues for all incident and project-based work.
  • Participate in Global Team collaboration efforts, including: shift handover, technical peer reviews, and knowledge transfers.
Education, Skills, and Background (including experience requirements):
  • 3 – 5 years of experience working in a large Enterprise or Service Provider environment.
  • Certified to CCNP level, or equivalent level of knowledge and experience.
  • Clear written and verbal communication skills.
  • Ability to prioritize and manage own workload.
  • Experience working within the Financial Industry Highly Preferred.
Required Skills:
  • Solid understanding of IPv4 addressing with the ability to subnet using VLSM.
  • Demonstrable understanding and experience supporting the following: o 802.1q VLANs and Trunks.
Multiple Spanning Tree Protocol.
o Etherchannel o Static Routing .
o OSPFv2 o BGPv4
o Routing protocol redistribution o Network Traffic Engineering using routing policies o Access Control Lists o Network Address Translation.
  • Good understanding of the TCP/IP stack and TCP/UDP operation.
  • Ability to diagnose the root cause of networking issues within complex network environments.
  • Ability to create and analyze packet captures to identify network and application issues.
  • Experience supporting Enterprise Firewall Platforms.
  • Experience configuring and troubleshooting IPSec VPNs.
  • Experience working with Network Management Systems utilizing SNMP & Syslog.
Preferred Skills:
  • Demonstrable understanding and experience supporting PIM Sparse Mode Multicast, Source Specific Multicast, and IGMPv2/v3.
  • Demonstrable understanding and experience supporting Network Time protocols – PTP, NTP, PPS.
  • Experience supporting the following platforms: Arista, Cisco Nexus, Cisco ASA, Fortigate, Palo Alto, Corvil.
  • Experience using Automation Technologies: Python, Ansible, Git.
Working Arrangements:
The working days for this role are Monday to Friday. The role holder will be expected to participate in a monthly shift rotation that consists of working a full-shift on one Saturday and on-call cover for the immediately following Sunday.
This is an office-based position, but occasional travel may be required by the business as part of this role.

++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++

Job #2-Team Lead Service Desk
**NO C2C or Visas-Full-Time/Perm Job. **NO Interns/Trainees Please.

The "Level 1 " Team Lead role is responsible for managing the operation of the "Level 1 " team (formerly known as "Service Desk”). This role is pivotal to providing professional and efficient "Level 1 " support. A key responsibility is to ensure that customer requirements are met in terms of communication, prioritization, and escalations.
A strong customer service mindset is crucial to succeeding in this role.
The Lead person will be hands on and will assist with standardizing "Level 1 " procedures and tools as well as making recommendations when discovering any inefficiencies. The Level 1 Service Operations Team are the 1st Point-of-Contact for all clients, providers and vendors service requests, service and maintenance alerts via Client's XXX technical Global Support Hotline, Ticketing System, email, or chat.

The "Level 1 " Team Lead will provide guidance, support, and motivation to the team members.
Oversee the activities of the team, delegate, and coordinate tasks to ensure client satisfaction and establish Level 1 team members objectives, monitor, evaluate performance and accountability in 24x7 Follow-The-Sun model.
Develop a timeline to complete projects and have the team members deliver within those timelines.
Produce and / or review KPIs, train the team members and motivate them to perform at their best.
The ideal candidate would have a demonstrated interest in Technology and Finance and prior experience leading a "Level 1” Team (or Service Desk).

Responsibilities and duties (include but not limited to):
Manage the day-to-day activities for the team, produce Key Performance Indicators (KPIs), propose/take corrective actions when the KPIs deviate from the expected outcome.
Develop a timeline to complete projects, publish project status updates.
Train the team members, ensure their knowledge is current.
Deliver and help the team deliver an outstanding level of service to our Customer base.
Display integrity and honesty.
Help monitor Client's XXX various monitoring and alerting systems, monitor the Service Operation's email and respond to the Service Operation hotline.
Help record all issues using our in-house ticketing system.
Provide and help the team provide first level problem determination/triage on all issues (network/systems/application) following simple run books. Provide guidance to the team members on such activities.
Help engage the relevant Subject Matter Experts and other Service Operation personnel, so they see the issue through to successful resolution.
Interface with client, vendors, market participants, and financial exchanges.
Channel formal communications to clients.
Generate statistics on issues raised, resolved, time to resolution and other Key Performance Indicators.
Foster open communication between team members, peer team members, and managers to bring forward ideas on how they can collectively deliver a more effective service.
In the purpose of the role, work as part of a Global Team that provides 24x7 "Level 1” cover on a rotation basis.
Education, Skills & Background (incl. Education and Experience Requirements):
Computer Science / applicable degree, or equivalent work experience is Preferred.
Understanding of Financial Markets (Equity, Futures, Options) Preferred.
Self-starter with a drive to develop own skills and knowledge.
Basic understanding of Networking.
Have excellent communication, influencing and customer management skills.
Team player.
Attentive to details.

Working Arrangements:
This is an office-based position, though currently remote due to the COVID-19 pandemic. Though travel may be required from time to time, it is not expected to be regular or frequent. The position holder will be expected to work whatever hours are necessary for the performance of this role (recognizing that it involves multiple jurisdictions / geographies including but not limited to EMEA, USA and APAC).

The coverage is "Follow the Sun - 24x7” so the team works in shifts ( "early” shift 7.30am ET to 4.30pm ET and "late” shift is 11 am ET to 8pm ET with 1hr lunch). Also, there is a rotation for Saturday/Sunday coverage.

Full Job Description

WHAT’S DIFFERENT ABOUT A TECHNOLOGY CAREER AT IMC?
At IMC, technology is not a department; it’s at the heart of everything we do. Since the late 1980s, we’ve pioneered the use of technology to advance the development of market making and low-latency trading. Today, our technologists work alongside traders in multidisciplinary teams to push the limits of possibility, and then look beyond. In our fast-paced environment, short feedback loops mean projects worked on in the morning can enter production the next day
SOFTWARE ENGINEER INTERNSHIP

Are you someone who is passionate about challenging the status quo?
Do you enjoy the process of problem solving, a process where you recognize areas of improvement and iterate and innovate to improve? Does your curiosity and desire to learn drive you?

ROLE OVERVIEW:

If so, then join IMC as an Software Engineer Intern! At IMC, Software Engineers don’t just write software and design technology. They are responsible for spotting new opportunities, developing new technologies and solving problems. As a result, they deliver results and make a difference. IMC knows that having the best software is what drives our business. Software development here is innovative, pragmatic and fun, even as complexity grows.

As a Software Engineer Intern you will learn what it means to be an Engineer in a real world environment. The internship programme is focused on enhancing your knowledge of algorithm complexity, data structures and writing fluent code. Your responsibility does not stop at programming; it also encompasses knowledge building of our business model and building relationships across our trading and technology teams.

As a Software Engineer intern at IMC you will be supported by both a Mentor and an intern lead who will oversee your projects and professional development. You will have access to classroom sessions, pair programming and code reviews, not to mention our incredible social activities and events.

WHAT WE LOOK FOR:

  • Student in penultimate year of Software Engineering or Computer Science related degree with a current GPA of 3.0 or higher
  • Must have strong knowledge of algorithms and data structures
  • Strong analytical skills and desire to solve complicated problems programmatically
  • Must have proficient experience in a programming language (Java or C++ preferred)
  • Willingness to interact and work closely with non-engineers in a constantly changing environment
  • Interest in the Financial Markets; previous knowledge is NOT required

WHO WE ARE

IMC is among the world’s leading proprietary trading firms, and a market maker in securities listed on exchanges across the globe. Our cutting-edge technology drives everything we do. High performance algorithms, smart strategies and collaborative teams are the core of our business.

Today, IMC is 500+ people working together to build software and trade financial products in our offices in Amsterdam, Chicago, and Sydney. What does this mean for you? The chance to join a multi-national, multi-cultural team of exceptional individuals, focused on making IMC the world’s best trading firm.

READY TO APPLY?
Our hiring process, including tips on applying and interviewing with IMC, is described on our website. Now it’s up to you! Apply today to start your journey with IMC.

IMC: JOIN THE LEADER IN GLOBAL MARKET MAKING
IMC is a leading global market maker with offices in Europe, the US and Asia-Pacific. We use algorithmic trading and advanced technology to buy and sell securities across multiple trading venues. Our vital role, at the centre of the financial markets, provides liquidity for buyers and sellers worldwide.
In the late 1980s, IMC quickly identified the importance of technology in the fast-evolving trading environment. Our passion for innovation continues to drive us today. Although our company has grown rapidly over recent decades, we still approach our work with the same entrepreneurial spirit, with an emphasis on continuous improvement and innovation. We like our people to think for themselves and we give them the responsibility and support they need to make an impact. This means real work as well as dedicated training programmes and mentors.
While we work hard, we also have a lot of fun – whether solving complex challenges or taking part in team-building, leisure and sporting activities. IMC also enables its employees to contribute to a better society through our foundation.

Position Information

Operating an extensive global computer network, the FedEx Services IT department contains approximately 5,000 professionals. IT positions range from highly technical to more business-focused, including but not limited to the following:

Application Development and Support

Business Analyst

Business Intelligence

Compliance

Computer Engineering

Development

Full-time internship opportunity from September 2021 to November 2021. This position can be domiciled in multiple areas across the US. This job posting is multiple areas within IT.

Business Analyst and Project Management-Focused Roles

Under close supervision, the successful candidate may assist with technology industry research, global business intelligence, and emerging trends analysis. Work may also include analysis of specific business metrics and research/analysis of data, industry trends, and market information. The project may relate to a mobile app, geo-fencing, revenue systems, or another initiative. Individuals will work either on a team of 4-6 interns or on individual project assignments.

The successful candidate may assist with one or more of the following:

Conduct data analytics, report development, and/or research for FedEx IT initiatives.

Interact with business partners and/or IT staff to gather, plan, design, implement, and document software requirements for a FedEx IT project matched to business needs, systems functions, and business process flows.

Address customer problems or requests for information on customer automation systems, FedEx software and/or FedEx deployed technologies.

Analyze business needs, implement customer solutions and provide technical product support.

Measuring and analyzing trends and validating need for process changes to maintain optimum customer support and satisfaction.

Support Information Security governance, risk management and compliance processes.

Assist with monitoring and reporting of internal compliance against external regulations and industry standards.

Assist with performance of risk assessments, oversight and enforcement activities to meet enterprise-wide information security requirements.

The ideal candidate will possess the following skills and experience:

Business and project/program management skills; organizational skills; ability to manage multiple tasks, set priorities and monitor ongoing results; leadership skills.

Basic knowledge of one or more of the following: the software development process, systems applications and architecture, networking, Query Languages, “R,” MATLAB, Python, C++, objective-C, C#, Swift, Java, iOS/Android Mobile development, and SQL.

Analytical and research skills; knowledge and/or experience with statistics or big data and report design/development.

Knowledge or experience with one or more of the following: data analytics, forecasting/modeling, strategy planning, and project management.

Experience in analytical/quantitative business, operations, or economics; coursework or experience in global studies.

Ability to synthesize large volumes of data (quantitative and qualitative).

Ability to solve business and technical customer-related issues.

Excellent verbal and written communication skills; presentation skills; knowledge of PowerPoint or Prezi and the Office suite.

Technical Roles

Under close supervision, the successful candidate will apply modern technology to assist with development of computer programs and applications for real-world FedEx business initiatives.

Projects may involve mobile applications, web development, Quality Assurance testing automation, big data platforms, revenue systems, and/or architecture development. Technologies used may include Tibco, Hibernate, ICEFACES, Ab Initio, Hadoop, Platfora, Spotfire, Java/J2EE & related frameworks, JMS, JavaScript, HTML5, .Net, C, C++, C#, Oracle, Weblogic, JBOSS, JDBC, subversion, and/or Query Languages such as PL/SQL.

The candidate may complete root cause analysis as well as test, document, and implement IT projects for FedEx IT initiatives. Individuals may also perform database design, database support, and systems enhancements. Individuals will work either on a team of 3-6 interns or on individual project assignments.

The ideal candidate will possess the following skills and experience:

Solid foundation in computing

Knowledge and/or experience with one or more of the following: Java/J2EE & related frameworks, JMS, JavaScript, HTML5, .Net, C, C++, C#, Oracle, SharePoint, Weblogic, JBOSS, JDBC, subversion, and/or Query Languages such as PL/SQL.

Knowledge and/or experience with one of the following: system administration, systems applications, systems architecture, database administration, and technical requirements analysis.

Familiarity with Unix, Linux or Windows administration and scripting.

Familiarity with designing and evaluating IT solutions.

Hardware and software technical background.

Experience in IT or Information Security.

Strong analytical and communication skills, including technical writing.

Basic understanding of business principles and project management.

Strong attention to detail and ability to complete large volumes of work efficiently and effectively.

The following are considered a plus:
Enrollment as undergraduate at junior year or above or graduate student in Business, Management, Project Management, Supply Chain, Transportation, Operations, Economics, Finance, Statistics, Business Analysis, Computer Engineering, Computer Science, Engineering, Electrical Engineering, Software Engineering, Information Science, Information Systems, Management Information Systems, Computer Information Systems, Network Engineering, Programming, Information Security, Mechanical Engineering, Information Technology, Information Engineering, Business Analysis, Data Structures and Analysis, or other quantitative major.

Ideally, plans to graduate within 12 months of completing the internship and begin full-time employment.

Full Job Description

Job Summary

The Cyber Security Intern position is an excellent opportunity to contribute to various aspects of cyber security, threat intelligence, vulnerability management, incident response, risk and compliance, identity and access, and security awareness programs at WC Bradley. The Cyber Security Intern will work independently and in a team to support the organizational strategy and assist in maturing W.C. Bradley co. cyber security processes. This is a temporary role with potential to grow into a permanent position.
The Cyber Security Intern helps identify and prevent cyber threats to W.C. Bradley by actively monitoring and maintaining several security related systems such as reviewing and analyzing security alerts, anti-virus alerts, patching and vulnerability scanning reports, and supporting related systems.
Duration of this Internship:

  • Part-time 20 hours per week
  • Remote work will be considered (GA, AL, FL residents only)
  • Position will run through the remainder of 2021 with a potential for permanent hire in 2022

Duties and Responsibilities

Expected Activities:

  • Daily monitoring of security tools to protect sensitive information (anti-virus, patching, firewalls, intrusion detection, etc.) using log correlation tools such as a Security Incident Event Management system (SIEM).
  • Assist with the development and implementation of security standards and best practices
  • Recommend security enhancements
  • Monitor the organization’s networks for security incidents and investigate violations when they occur
  • Assist with the development of IT Security training for company employees
  • Assist with vulnerability scanning and patch management
  • identify and define system security requirements (Networks/Servers/PCs/Web Applications, etc.)
  • Assist with the configuration of security infrastructure devices
  • Assist with developing technical solutions and research security tools to help enhance IT security
  • Assist with detecting, responding, and recovering from security-related incidents and events
  • Recommend and assist with developing automation through scripting/coding
  • Examines malware and malicious scripts
  • Administers logical access controls and performs recurring entitlement reviews
  • Other duties as assigned

Qualification Requirements

Candidate Requirements:

  • Currently enrolled as a Junior or Senior in a Bachelor of Science degree program for computer science or related field
  • Advanced knowledge of Information Technology
  • Foundational understanding of basic security concepts like encryption, separation of duties, and malware, intrusion detection
  • Some familiarity with security best practices and industry standards (e.g. NIST, ISO, CIS, COBIT, OWAP, etc.)
  • Ability to prioritize, meet deadlines, and manage changing priorities
  • Must be at-least eighteen years of age
  • Must be able to pass pre-employment background check and drug screening

Full Job Description

We are looking for a passionate Backend Software Engineer to design, develop and install software solutions. Software Engineer responsibilities include gathering user requirements, defining system functionality, and writing code in Python and Flask. Our ideal candidates are familiar with the software development life cycle (SDLC) from preliminary system analysis to tests and deployment and is looking for a real-life experience. Ultimately, the role of the Software Engineer is to build high-quality, innovative, and fully performing software that complies with coding standards and technical design.

Responsibilities

  • Execute a full software development life cycle (SDLC)
  • Develop flowcharts, layouts and documentation to identify requirements and solutions
  • Write well-designed, testable code
  • Produce specifications and determine operational feasibility
  • Integrate software components into a fully functional software system
  • Develop software verification plans and quality assurance procedures
  • Document and maintain software functionality
  • Troubleshoot, debug and upgrade existing systems
  • Deploy programs and evaluate user feedback
  • Comply with project plans and industry standards
  • Ensure software is updated with the latest features

Skills

  • Proven work experience as a Software Engineer or Software Developer
  • Experience designing interactive applications
  • Ability to develop software and web applications in Python and Flask.
  • Excellent knowledge of relational databases, SQL and ORM technologies (JPA2, Hibernate)
  • Experience with test-driven development
  • Proficiency in software engineering tools
  • Ability to document requirements and specifications
  • BSc degree in Computer Science, Engineering or relevant field

Job Types: Part-time, Internship

Experience:

  • Flask: 1 year (Required)
  • Databases: 1 year (Required)
  • Python: 1 year (Required)
